author: {'steamid': '76561198034352021', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1692780110}
review:
As someone with a friend named Melissa with a last name beginning with K,  I felt like I absolutely needed to try this game and had a fun time playing through on the easiest difficulty. Now having said that, this IS NOT a good game! But it is functional and enjoyably bad. Characters awkwardly talk at each other with little regard to what the characters are saying in response, and for some reason the main character only finds this strange and mentions it with 1 particular character. 

Everything about this game is random. In hidden object puzzles some object wont be there unless you interact with other items that arent on the list to unlock a drawer or change the scene a bit. this may be annoying on medium or hard difficulty where youd be penalized for mis-clicks. For the most part the puzzles were fun and got me thinking, but some of the puzzles towards the end I just couldn't see any logic in and the final puzzle seemed to be more about speed and reaction time which was inconsistent with the entire rest of the game. your frequently expected to know to backtrack to certain areas to find something new or progress. some items appear on your item bar and reusable items show in small icons near the hint button so they were easy to forget i had them to solve puzzles. 

But even with all these problems it had an ok story with a decent (though forseeable) plot twist and going through the scenes and seeing where everything was hidden was fun. The previously mentioned terrible voice acting and voice directing was actually an enjoyable highlight for me. I wish there was a meh option because i wouldnt recommend this to everyone. but if you have low expectations and want something funny to play on easy then give it a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116723828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1681482789}
review:
I cannot in good faith recommend this game. This was a port from mobile. Certain achievements would be easy when tapping a touch screen, but are not possible for the average HOG player by demanding a certain level of extreme perfection that is characteristic of "Dark Soul-like" games. This is likely never to be fixed (grant additional time for the constellation and brick door for adventurer and expert) because the developers took 3 years to remove 5 fully bugged achievements.

The story also loses the plot around halfway in and progressively gets worse. I play HOGs with the expectation the story will be mediocre or mildly bad. This one is particularly egregious.

If you don't care about achievements and you don't mind bad story, I still couldn't recommend it even at a steep discount, because other developers should get your money instead of this one.

If the developers ever correct the achievement "Just Call Me Ace" to either be removed or allot times to  accommodate playing on PC, then I would recommend the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293258319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1669161643}
review:
Являясь истинным поклонником оригинального жанра, игра совершенно меня не впечатлила. 
Сюжет мне показался сложным, странным, неинтересным. 
Предметы появляются часто после исследования локаций, зачастую безо всяких причин (просто так). Это как минимум странно и отбивает желание проходить игру без подсказок.
Что насчет плюсов, это возможность "немного" прокручивать камеру, неплохая для своего времени графика. Также порадовала фича с фонариком (не часто такое встречаешь, что можно все освещать).
В общем прошел игру для галочки, красная цена ей, думаю, 25 рублей (ровно за столько я ее и купил).
Но истинным поклонникам ознакомится и поиграть в игру стоит, ведь, как говорится: "На вкус и цвет..."

author: {'steamid': '76561197985130407', 'num_games_owned': 818, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1644852531}
review:
Ahh, I held such high hopes for this game!  The game was recommended in a Steam review for an Artifex Mundi HOAG I was interested in, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/429610/The_Emerald_Maiden_Symphony_of_Dreams/]The Emerald Maiden: Symphony of Dreams[/url]  That review's recommendations were helpful when I was just getting into this pixel-hunting subgenre, and I bought, played, and enjoyed all of his Artifex Mundi suggestions.

https://steamcommunity.com/id/absurdlogic/recommended/429610/

I've had Melissa K. since my very first foray into HOAG back in summer of 2020, and I finally got around to playing it.  The game immediately caught my attention because its scenes were constructed to be slightly 3D.  They achieved this effect by combining 2D backgrounds, 2D sprites, and 3D models.  The camera can be slightly rotated, letting you see that the sprites have parallax and some of the objects in the environment are actually 3D models.  It's clever, interesting, and creates the possibility of hiding objects behind things.

Melissa K.'s uniqueness in its presentation doesn't stop there.  There are in-engine cutscenes, animated by motion capture of living actors' performances.  The characters don't do much more than stand around in these cutscenes, but it adds a human element that most HOAGs don't have.  Most are pretty bleak and lonely, but Melissa K. is constantly surrounded by characters.

Despite initially impressing me, my sentiment soon soured.  This game does not have the kind of design that I want from a casual adventure game.  It's so damn cryptic all the time!  I can fill my inventory with items, and have no clue what any of them could possibly be used for.  Progressing in the game never flows smoothly, and often came to a screeching halt because I'll accomplish something, but not receive anything new.  So I have to go back to the drawing board to figure out what I'm supposed to do.  Or...

I eventually started using the hint system without reservations.  Sometimes when I used it, the hints revealed things I should have figured out on my own, but often the hints pointed me to spots on the screen that I had no idea held any significance.

This ties into the art of the game, which while often imaginative, is poorly rendered.  Everything is fuzzy and blurry and muddy and murky.  There are textures that don't line up properly and other technical errors.  The artists didn't use light to guide the player's eye to areas of significance.  In fact, the game has a flashlight mechanic for illuminating dark areas.  But there's no indication of which dark areas might have something of interest, so that means randomly shining it over dimly lit areas on the screen, 99% of which have nothing.  The mechanic is just awful.  The lighting effect of the flashlight is impressive, though.

This game has several puzzles I'd never seen before.  That's always nice to see after all the puzzle and adventure games I've played as a gamer.  I'd read reviews complaining about a "Tetris" puzzle near the end, and when I got to it, I lost several times before I picked up the rhythm of it.  I can see why people might not like it because it's a speed-based challenge, but I just played DOOM Eternal on Ultra-Violence difficulty, so I was good for it.

Melissa K. was a huge disappointment to me.  I haven't written everything I wanted to say about it, but I think I've spent enough effort on this review.  Try Melissa K. when you've had enough of the standard HOAG formula that 99% of games use, and don't allow yourself to get frustrated with it - just slam that hint button.  There's no penalty of any kind for using it.  Actually, there's an achievement for using it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025175649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1639972253}
review:
This game works with Windows 10 no problem, make sure you are setting the game using Nvidia graphics card or AMD.

If you want a game that plays like Art of Murder or Syberia with a story but with tons of Hidden object puzzles, this is the game you should get. There is a full walkthrough guide on steam if you get stuck. All of the puzzles except two of them are easy to beat. This is one of those Hidden gem games lost in being one of the top point & click game unlike Art of Murder or Syberia due to it not having any sequels.  

There is a" bonus video" after beating the entire game to show how the game was made. You are not required to play the game at the hardest difficulty and you can change the difficulty at any time due to the fact that the puzzles are unlocked to be re-playable in the box menu. (I beat it on Adventure mode). You can use "help" button infinite times on puzzles or during campaign and it won't ruin your accuracy rating. The only thing "help" ruins accuracy rating is the Hidden Object games.

If your going for achievements, don't bother with it. You'll rage at certain puzzles.
The puzzles that is extremely difficult to beat are the followings:

1. Last Puzzle - the Door game on Expert mode.
2. Zodiac Telescope when trying to beat the best time.

For "Animal Whisperer Achievement" you are not required to replay the entire game(Missing Animals).

1. There is a Caged Monkey in the Hidden Object Buddha's Altar game on Top Left area where you can free him.
2. In Hanging Decorations Hidden Object Game there are two cage bird you can free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101776626', 'num_games_owned': 5243, 'num_reviews': 459, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1622048664}
review:
I'm not done with the game, but, here is why I don't recommend it.
You spend your time clicking on things that were there but not clickable before so you thought there was nothing to it, things that appear which weren't there before and have to think of the most convoluted solution to your problem. You also collect things which aren't used until much much later and it makes even less sense in the end. 
I'm going to give you a few example of what I mean :
- You collect stones for some reasons, until your character begins to speak of beavers while being in a river. Alright, so you get it, you have to put those stones in front of a waterfall to empty the river. The stones are HUGE, how does she even carry six of those ? Also, one of the stone you have to find is in the foreground and 100% looks like basic decoration.
- You get a green banana and there is a monkey which holds an item for you. While your instinct tells you to give the monkey that green banana, it's not how you should do. Instead, you have to plunge the green banana on some random cooking oil you find [i]on the floor[/i] (yes, like a puddle) and it transforms the green banana into a yellow banana and then you can give it to the monkey. 
I'm trying hard to be positive, but you need to spam the help or to use a guide to go through it without flipping a table, thankfully you receive no penalty for using the help and it recharges instantly, there is even an achievement for clicking on it 50 times.. This says a lot about the logic of that game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025089345', 'num_games_owned': 2174, 'num_reviews': 2934, 'playtime_forever': 556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 556, 'last_played': 1613442802}
review:
点击冒险游戏，而且是3D视角（类似like 2D那种可以移动的那种~有些时候你能看出物件是2D贴图，但是光影特效很棒~）
而且你还能在对话的时候看到主角的手在动呀动~好像很···
一开始游戏总在营造一种恐怖气氛的感觉~后面直接变成恐怖场景~
[h1]~简单难度可以~全程使用提示看完剧情~流程5个小时左右~[/h1]

简单剧情：[spoiler] 
主角梅丽莎似乎收到了邀请，去了泰国的某个寺庙！到达目的地后只想早点休息的主角在大半夜做噩梦就算了，噩梦后还被向导Deveij叫起来说某弟子失踪了！
于是开始找ing~？？从住处到图书馆到地下室，然后还遇到了梅丽莎的朋友？
可惜使用炸药的过程中炸伤了向导Deveij，而这人说不要包扎，只要那个莫名奇妙的东东？Emmm 佛主脚下的····？
最后发现向导和他的双胞胎在进行邪恶仪式来召唤邪神，而主角被利用了！
而那个邀请函也是那个朋友自己写的···emmmm~
然后又是一脸懵逼地按提示操作，老和尚为了打开通路自己跳进火海，最后主角救下了小和尚···emmmm~
 [/spoiler]
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2397231822
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2397232174
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2397232647

~里面的人说话都玄乎其玄~难以理解的感觉~
[h1]~感觉剧情和收集很牵强~
~但对我这种无脑玩家还是能通过简单模式无限提示看完剧情的~[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198220304959', 'num_games_owned': 6170, 'num_reviews': 864, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1610918032}
review:
Uma pegada de indiana jones com tomb raider. 

È um ótimo game de objetos ocultos, com uma ótima personagem !! 
A história não deixa a desejar, apresenta alguns cliches de roteiro; mais isso é básico e aceitável.
Os desafios são bem oks e tem bastante conteudo e os personagens são bem cativantes, detalhe que há muitas frases de efeito nos diáligos.. O que surpreende pois é um jogo bastante casual. 

O game deixa claro em quem se inspira visto o chapéu que é sempre evidenciado em cgs e pelos artefatos encontrados !! 

É um ótimo game,bem resolvido, simples e divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056536414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 424, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1603072203}
review:
Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold Collector's Edition est un jeu de type aventure parsemé de puzzles, d'énigmes et d'objets cachés dans lequel on incarne une aventurière dans un périple en Thaïlande (pointer et cliquer) sorti en septembre 2014 et développé par SDP Games. 

En bref, l'histoire se déroule en 1947, aux quatre coins d'une Thaïlande emplie de mythes, contes et personnages issus du folklore bouddhiste. Lorsque Mélissa est invitée par la Reine d'Angleterre en personne, elle ne se doute pas que sa vie va basculer et qu'une simple mission va la conduire à se remettre en question l'essence même de son existence.

Une histoire qui tient la route avec des énigmes intéressantes qui nous plonge parfaitement dans l'ambiance de la religion bouddhiste avec la possibilité d'avoir trois niveaux (facile , normal , expert).

Nous pouvons noter quelques points positifs ainsi que négatifs:

- les points positifs : 
- l'ambiance immersive (musique en accord avec l'ambiance et l'environnement) 
- l’histoire scindée en deux avec des décors bien distincts, dont un qui est apocalyptique.
- l'histoire attrayante qui nous donne envie de la terminer en une seule prise.

- Les points négatifs : 
- les péripéties s'éloignent un peu trop de l'intrigue principale.
- ce que je reproche surtout à Melissa K, c'est son jeu. 

Bien que les listes d'objets à trouver sont globalement moins tirées par les cheveux que d'autres jeux du genre, le jeu  rend la recherche assez frustrante. Il faut soit cliquer à l'aveugle soit utiliser un indice... Comment savoir que telle boite s'ouvre, mais point l'autre ? 

Comment savoir qu'il faut faire glisser tel objet (alors que les autres ne bougent pas) pour trouver le bon objet en dessous ? En effet, contrairement à d'autres pointer et cliquer, il y a un seul et unique curseur, pas de loupe, ou d'engrenage.

En conclusion : Vous recevrez 3 cartes sur 6 et 26 succès +/- facile à obtenir, je recommande  ce jeu... vraiment bien... mais avec remise.

Amicalement
Le pasteur

.

review: It's an okay game, but highly buggy. I beat the game 3 times (Both normal and CE editions). Not because I wanted to, not because it was fun but rather to obtain some bugged achievements where I had to delete my game save and play through the game again.. And a gain. I ended up memorizing where every hidden object was, at least when they were there... Sometimes on second playthrough there are just no objects in the scene to be found, but the list is given to you. There is a very well written guide for this game in the guides section that explains how to avoid such bugs, I wish I had found it sooner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159331926', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1584827752}
review:
The concept was cool. The execution was... a mess.

Pros:
-????

Cons:
-The characters sucked. Melissa's ex who kept showing up was an ass who couldn't accept the fact that Melissa left him. All of the Thai characters were kinda crappy stereotypes, and White Girl Melissa was the Chosen One.
-The fact that this was a mobile-to-PC port made the whole game have really janky controls.

If you want an "Indiana Jones but a girl" game, go try the first two Syberia games, or the Tomb Raider games, or the first two Chronicles of Mystery games and give this game a hard pass.

review:
Pros: Decent story, but the worst of the 8 or 9 HO games I have played.  Lots of achievements (more than the other HO games I have played); however, read the cons too, decently long game.

Cons: All achievements are NOT obtainable IF you collect a buddha from certain HO scenes, then try to beat the best % in the same HO scene in the extras, because thew buddhas count toward the % but are not present again after finding them in a previous playthrough.  I am a completionist (attempts 100% in all agmes played) so NO, i do not recommend thjis game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115792031', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2030, 'last_played': 1578323430}
review:
[h1]Musste es ein weiblicher Indiana Jones sein, die zur gleichen Zeit agiert, wie der alte peitscheschwingende Cowboyhut?[/h1]

...scheinbar ja. Das hatte mich schon gestört, doch man lernt ja darüber hinweg zu sehen, da die meisten Adventures eben Indi als Stilikone (Hut, Beige- oder Kakifarbene, abgenutzen Klamotten) benutzen.. doch dann kamen die Videosequenzen.. die Musik... die Geschichte.. und der ganze Rest!

Wer das klassische Wimmelbildspiel sucht, der möge bitte weiter suchen, denn hier handelt es sich um eine Mischung aus Point'n Click, Adventure, HiddenObject und Rate-um-die-Wette-mit-den-Entwicklern. Ich selbst habe es, glaube ich, im Sale erworben und mich sehr gefreut.. bis ich es durch hatte und mir manche Errungenschaften fehlten.. beim zweiten Durchgang dann eine Erkenntnis: Da fehlt doch was in der Story, oder? Und was ist das? Davon habe ich ja noch nie etwas gesehen.. Scheinbar baut sich das Game willkürlich aus verschiedenen Elementen zusammen, weswegen entweder die Geschichte nicht stimmig scheint oder aber so dumpf ist, dass man nicht mehr folgen will. Für mal eben zwischendurch ist das Game jedenfalls nicht.

+ sehr schöne Szenerien
+ nette Melodien

- Stereotypische Archäologin
- beängstigende Charaktere 
- lasche Story
- irgendwann nur noch nervig

[h1]Kein Spiel für Zwischendurch, aber ok, wenn man sich durchringen kann, es zu spielen[/h1]
Im Sale kann man sich das Teil durchaus für unter einem Euro gönnen und man muss es nicht gänzlich runter machen, dennoch bleibt ein fader Beigeschmack und die Motivation lässt stetig nach.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189473109', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1588463489}
review: É um desses jogos de aventura clicker, que combina puzzles, caça ao tesouro, alguns enigmas e muitos colecionáveis desafiadores. Ótimo para quem gosta desses tipos de desafios. O visual é simples e bonito, não exige nada do computador. Terminei o jogo uma única vez no normal e gastei umas 5h nisso. Para conseguir todos os colecionáveis e conquistas levaria bem mais tempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075462976', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 376, 'last_played': 1587916521}
review:
Gioco comprato in un bundle da 50 giochi a 1$.

Un'avventura grafica mediocre, per fortuna breve ma che riesce comunque a cadere nel noioso.

La trama non è male affatto, seppur viene raccontata in un modo non molto avvincente.
Bella la possibilità di giocare l'avventura nei panni di un personaggio secondario, peccato che i suoi obiettivi siano ridicoli in confronto a quelli della protagonista.

Gli sfondi sono fatti bene, anche se a volte non è troppo chiaro se ci siano aree raggiungibili dalla posizione attuale e si deve ricorrere all'aiuto.
I modelli 3D non sono granché e le animazioni sono peggio, cosa che rende fastidiosi i dialoghi con i personaggi, che a volte sembrano messi lì tanto per allungare il brodo.

Gli enigmi alla Professor Layton sono molto graziosi, ma sono davvero tanti e spesso non hanno un legame con la storia o un motivo per farla andare avanti, ma costituiscono solo la sfida del momento per ottenere un oggetto utile in seguito.
Anche la ricerca degli oggetti chiave è complicata e controintuitiva, poiché spesso bisognerà tornare indietro a posizioni già visitate per scoprire che qualcosa è cambiato senza nessun preavviso, oppure si trovano in punti già controllati ma senza successo o altro, portando quindi a fare un uso eccessivo dei suggerimenti.

Non sono rimasto soddisfatto, ci sono avventure grafiche migliori.
Potrei consigliarlo comunque se si trova a un prezzo veramente irrisorio o gratis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198829516918', 'num_games_owned': 168, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1585637902}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008683738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1586252057}
review:
[h1]Some port or whatever I just don't care anymore, they certainly didn't[/h1]

Let me be clear: I hate resorting to suggesting this, but this game has so many things wrong with it I encourage everyone to get steam achievement manager to mop up the hardest achievement. In the same vein as Pixel Puzzles Ultimate, there's just a mountain of things to do with no respect to our gaming backlogs.

I'll start off by saying I love HOGs, I've played a bunch now and I get used to certain standards. What I don't like is a slightly panning view, so that you can never see a full scene at any given point. I also do not like being forced to play expert mode, and trying to piece together ridiculous non-existent clues as to items hidden in scenes, clicking around like I have epilepsy.

And what I especially loathe is ridiculous achievements that haven't been adjusted from being ported over from a mobile version. One of them asks for you to beat all scores and times, which wouldn't be so bad if there weren't so goddam many of them. Not to mention everyone's favourite tetris door, where you need a hundred fingers tapping at a zillion keys per minute - and you are not allowed to make a single mistake. I kid you not, it is THAT bad.

Conversations are so stilted and awkward, and the models mouths are so huge that you can't help but roll around in hysterics. And then there's the Mister Doctor guy you play as in the 'collector edition', who's so cheesy you almost wonder if he's not some old Dr Who villain from the '70s. He's desperate for some love too so that's even more weird.

About the only thing this game has going for it are the background visuals, which are based on actual places, if you check the developer video in the extras. That and the monk that tries to meditate only to fall asleep.

If the target times for beating scores was given a bit extra room for jerky mouse movements and unforced errors, and it didn't force expert on you for an achievement, I'd be willing to gloss over the corny characters. But here's some things to think about - if you're going to go to the effort of motion capture, why not just get actual actors dressed up, or if you're going to do a few panning camera scenes, might as well go full 360 spherical views. I have played games that have done these things before, and they're right here on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044715770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1582385075}
review:
This is a game with some really cool ideas. It could be awesome, but the user interface is horribly clunky. It tries to be 3D, but mostly that just results in making it really tricky to see key objects in scenes or to click on them once you find them. Navigation is terrible, since you often have to shift the viewpoint just to see the area for moving to a different room so you can click on it. The artwork is very beautiful, the music is nice. The plot and dialogue are generic. HOGs are different than usual, but not in a good way. Puzzles are generic.

Overall, a really promising game that stumbles badly over its own feet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198134161766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 322, 'last_played': 1577482452}
review:
Esta análise foi criada a partir da perspectiva de 2 jogadores. Jogamos ele juntos, logo faremos a análise em conjunto.

Pra quem gosta de jogos de puzzle esse jogo é um belo passatempo. Tem vários cenários bem interativos e com uma historia bem interessante sobre o budismo, você se aventura por Bangkok para desvendar alguns dos mistérios que lhe são fornecidos.

Vários minijogos diversificados porém alguns deles são bugados, você faz o que se é pedido e não consta como concluído, ou ele diz para fazer uma coisa e quando você a faz, mostra que você errou. Outro ponto negativo é que em muitos dos episódios você tem que ir para lugares aleatórios ou que ficam do outro lado do planeta, e aparentemente não tem como você saber disso sem usar a dica ! Isso nos deixa muito perdido no jogo, nos sentimos muito dependentes da dica para poder jogar, isso porque jogamos na dificuldade "médio" .

Tirando isso é um jogo que você consegue passar o tempo bem de boa, mas não vale o preço que tem!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033388937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 294, 'playtime_forever': 3019, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1577008198}
review:
NOTE:  The negative reviews on this game are mostly about mechanical/app errors and dev responsiveness, not game play or content.  It appears that the main problem has been fixed:  the Achievements that weren't working on Steam have been removed (from the required Steam Achievements).  At this point (2019), I can only comment on what's there now.

An excellent HOPA, with an unusual emphasis on the Adventure play.  More open-ended and challenging than more recent games, but has a good difficulty-level setting:  your choice of Casual, Adventure, or Hard changes the level of the puzzles and overall gameplay, not just basics like how quickly the Hint button recharges.

It's slightly dated, and the 3D visuals sometimes feel clunky  (you can rotate the map side to side and up and down), but I was still impressed with the creativity and extra scope compared to the usual HOPA.  The HO scenes are good and there are a good number of puzzles.  The art is quite lovely, and the music fits well.  I enjoyed the protagonist's voice acting.

I suggest getting it on sale, but it's definitely worth adding it to your collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009393197', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1568553503}
review:
This one was tiresome. A 40/100 effort.

[b]The good[/b]

Good production values
HO scenes were great
Voice acting above par

[b]The bad[/b]

Ported tablet/phone game - need to pan through scenes, and it's not handled well
Easy to miss clues, backgrounds can be dark, or things at the edge of the screen
Endless, boring puzzles
Those facial animations...
Blah story, Indiana Jones rip off that's just plain stupid

author: {'steamid': '76561197970859560', 'num_games_owned': 5618, 'num_reviews': 358, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1567037636}
review: This was cute. The help system (which you will use a lot, A LOT) ensures you'll never get stuck. Honestly I don't see how this would be possible without using the helper basically all the time. Many critical objects blend into the art or obscured entirely by darkness. That aside, once you've resigned yourself to clicking the help medallion basically every 15 seconds, most of the puzzles are fair, the story, cutscenes, and characters are goofy and trite but in a fun way, and the graphics are impressive.

If this problems can be fix it will be amazing, and I looking forward for this type of games or a continued of the story. Overall it is a great game to play and enjoying the artworks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198293009255', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 682, 'last_played': 1562402062}
review:
เนื้อเรื่อง เรื่องราวความเชื่อในไทย
จุดเด่น ภาพสวย ภาษาไทย
ข้อเสีย ตอนแก้ปริศนาสนุก แต่วนไปวนมาการเดินปริศนาบางอย่างยากแบบไม่มีเหตุผล เนื้อเรื่องชวนงงไม่หน้าติดตาม 

กราฟฟิกการนำเสนอ 8/10 
เกมส์เพลย์ 4/10 การเชื่อมต่อของปริศนาไม่หน้าติดตาม กระโดดไปมาไม่ลื่นไหล
ความแปลกใหม่ 4/10 เน้นแก้ปริศนาไม่ได้เน้นหาของในฉาก แต่ชอบซ่อนของมากกว่า
ความคุ้มค่า 4/10 ซื้อมาถูกตอนลดราคาถ้าซื้อราคาเต็มคงเสียดายเงิน แต่เกมส์ภาพสวยสำหรับแนวนี้งานภาพดี
ภาพรวม 5/10 ไม่สนุกอย่างที่คิด ตอนแรกคิดว่าเป็นภาษาไทยคงสนุกกับเนื้อเรื่องโดยรวมแล้วผิดหวังไปหน่อย
แต่ก็ขอแนะนำให้เล่นดูเพื่อจะชอบเพราะเป็นภาษาไทยซื้อตอนลดนะจะดีกว่า

author: {'steamid': '76561197975900611', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1556080334}
review: I'll open by saying that I'm pretty sure I got this game for free, and while I do recommend it,  I'd say only grab it if/when it goes on sale.  The game is a good mix between point-and-click adventure, puzzle, and "hidden picture".  I think the main maps themselves are a bit tricky, and I found I had to rely on the built-in "hints" system quite a bit to figure out where to go next.  The puzzles themselves are mostly logical and follow a general progression.  The only real cheesy part I found was in the character animations and dialogue.  They're very unnatural.

author: {'steamid': '76561198418030513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1554563674}
review:
Whether or not there's broken achievements, i dont really care;however i was really disappointed when there were some broken hints. The main game was easy enough to finish and gives more playing time. I really like the added films and artwork, but after the main game, there's a extra mini games to play and those are definitely broken. i just couldn't even finish that. Overall, it's not bad, especially if you get it at a sale price. I wouldnt really recommended at regular price for the broken achievements and side game that is broken.
edit if there were a "neutral" button it'd be good but honestly unless they fix bugs for achievements and other broken hints, its not really good to play. Otherwise, itd be somewhat of an interesting short HOG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128698236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1649244229}
review:
ただただ面倒くさいだけの捜し物系ゲームです。

カーソルが全く変化しないので、クリックしてみないとアクションが起きる場所かどうかが分からない。
そのくせ、アクションが起こせる場所にもかかわらず説明文のでない所もある。
無反応だった場所でも、その後アクションが起きるポイントに変わってたり、アイテムを使用する所だったりする。
アイテムの説明も意味不明なものだったりして、どこに何を使えばよいのか全く分からない。
移動、アイテム、画面内クリックと全てが総当たりです。

このゲームは3Dが売りなのですが、パズルでも3Dのものがあります。
ドラッグして全体を回転させたり、仕掛けを回したりするのですが、ここの操作性が非常に悪い。
仕掛けを回そうとしているのに、全体が動いてしまったりとか、意図していない方向に回転したりだとかでイライラさせられます。

物語、登場人物にも全く魅力を感じなったため、非常につらいゲーム体験を強いられました。
このゲームは全くおすすめできません。

日本語訳だけはわりとまともでした。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004372851', 'num_games_owned': 762, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 430, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 430, 'last_played': 1550018127}
review: Man this was a frustrating experience.  My wife and I are big fans of hidden object games but this one was just so obtuse.  The art design is actually pretty good and nice to look at, the ability to look around was a nice touch. However, the puzzles and game play are impossible without a guide.  We tried to play this game for 3 hours and we couldn't even get out of the first chapter.  Then we spent 3 hours just mashing the hint button and trying to muscle thru the rest of it.  Finally we just gave up and used a walk thru.  The remaining 50% of the game was defeated in an hour.  Poor design, I don't recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079682961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1543615258}
review: This game is impressive, the quality is awesome. It the best game. Better than fortnite. The quality is unique. The story was better than twilight. I bought a whole new gaming PC, two GTX 1080 TIs, an i9 7900X, 128 gigabytes of RAM, making sure I can play this wonder at 8k 144 FPS. I don't just recommend this game, I'm telling you to play it. If you don't, you are missing out on the reason humans exist. Every single person should play this game. I will fight wars to make sure people can continue playing this game. I have stayed in my room since this came out, which is the day I wrote this, and I haven't talked to anyone except the NPCs in this game. I think this is the next step in human evolution. We will eventually all be plugged into a machine, like in the movie, "The Matrix", where this beautiful masterpiece will be our life. Every day, we will wake up in heaven. Every night, we will go to sleep on the copy-pasted textures on the ground. That soon will be the glorious reality, the reality we are meant to be in. We have all needed this game to get through all of our diseases, mental illnesses, WW2, and anything else ever need fixing. Download this game right now, it should only take you a second, and play it. Enjoy it. Live it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034530531', 'num_games_owned': 4365, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1541616029}
review:
I can't recommend this one, whilst I do like the clever use of parallax scrolling to get a 3d effect, that isn't enough to make up for the tedious gameplay. 

It is just too random and meaningless, there is an extreme amount of to-ing and fro-ing which seems to be there just for the sake of making the game last longer and there's no intuitive way to know where you should be going, things just turn up randomly in locations you've already visited 20 times. I found myself spamming the hint button endlessly in order to find the next random thing in some random location that I'd already visited. And I'm not mad about the hidden object games which can be completed quicker by rapidly clicking around the image than by searching for the items. There are a couple of puzzles which I hadn't seen before but they don't make up for the general tedium of this game.

Too much stupid. Pick up rocks from places rocks wouldn't be and they weren't there before, stick them in your pocket for later, dam a river with them, WTF? Why is there a large cinema in the middle of the temple???????? Why am I blowing away a wall in a sewer under the temple???? And as for the ******* annoying weirdo monk that talks complete whack, who has 5 objects for you but you have to revisit him like half a dozen times for no good reason. And objects hidden in locations - that are basically invisible so how are you supposed to know they are there without either spam clicking or using the hint??????

Avoid.

https://youtu.be/nwOtTEPn6qk?list=PLgYZP8HR5eDLig9ZOjrwSR28oNbfApfD4&t=202
FML ^ 03:22

author: {'steamid': '76561198332532731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1540292313}
review:
优缺点都很明显。推荐给这类游戏玩的比较多的人，因为这款非常特别。
优点：中文、便宜、流程长、小游戏超多且难度适中，感觉和普通的点点点游戏不太一样，制作组相当用心。
缺点：有的地方要用道具或需要拖动，点了不给反馈。有些原本只是背景的地方，过了剧情，背景没任何变化却需要点击，总之寻物方面不太合理，没耐心的直接按提示了。

author: {'steamid': '76561198812162622', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 264, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 507, 'last_played': 1534086227}
review: I wanted to like this game, but I got really bored with it.  Graphics were old, especially the animation.  The 3D scenes made me dizzy.  Objects to find were really miniscule and I got quite annoyed with that.  Some of the puzzles were impossible and undeciperable, so the skip and hint buttons were spammed.  I'm not interested in the achievements and only got 50% anyway.  Gameplay was long...took over 8 hours.  Final puzzle on the door was impossible to do with a mouse, so that got skipped.  Setting of game was a bonus....being in Thailand.  I can't recommend as it wasn't intuitive and was clunky at times.  4.5 out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253660543', 'num_games_owned': 1683, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1532772269}
review:
这是一个点击解谜游戏，自带官方中文。故事背景发生在泰国，融合了泰国民间传说，通过男女主角两个视角展开冒险。故事从一起失踪事件开始，逐步揭露出背后的秘密。

亮点：
+相比同类型游戏，最大亮点是视角可以转动一定角度，场景显得更生动，有动感；
+双主角视角，剧情内容比较丰富，通关大概需要8-9个小时，追求全收集会更久一些；
+环境描绘的比较精细，气氛营造的也不错，有悬疑的感觉；
+辅助道具挺多，谜题花样也比较丰富，难度不算大，而且可以选择提示，不至于卡关。

不足：
-剧情一般，很多地方交代的不是很清楚；
-谜题出现的比较突兀，和剧情结合的不好；
-可交互物品没有高亮提示，全靠乱点；
-很多场景探索完毕，随着剧情推进还会出现新的道具，却没有相关暗示，解谜很不友好。

其他：
官方翻译质量一般，仅能看明白剧情。

整体来看是一款不错的小品式解谜游戏，感觉放在手游上体验会更好，适合喜欢解谜的玩家，关注剧情的玩家可能会失望。

author: {'steamid': '76561198067002281', 'num_games_owned': 1066, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2306, 'last_played': 1532933893}
review:
[i]Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold[/i] is a hidden object game similar to others of the same genre. The storyline makes a good attempt at being memorable with a decent plot twist thrown in there. Plus the game is packed full of content which will leave you playing it long after your original playthrough. There are also many unique & challenging puzzles contained within it.

[u][b]Gameplay:[/b][/u]
You can choose from novice, adventure, and expert. These will hold your hand in varying degrees from little to not at all, but the help button will always be there if you need it. Choosing not to push it at all will reward you with an achievement, so there is an incentive to challenge yourself. Most of the hidden object games are fairly easy with some of the puzzles proving to be more difficult for myself, only because I chose to go for the highscores though. The game also gives you tools such as a gecko (to get in small spaces) and a flashlight (to see in dark corners). I know it isn't anything too fancy, but it just adds another layer onto the very cut and dry hidden object formula.

[u][b]Graphics:[/b][/u]
The game supports up to 4k resolution. This is nice when looking at it's beautifully drawn well lit environments. However the game lets itself down in the cutscenes with many of the characters wide mouthed arm flailing expressions looking more like a Chuck E. Cheese animatronic.

[u][b]Story:[/b][/u]
Both Melissa and her companion Julian were boring and forgettable. I didn't care about them or the young monk that I was looking for. Perhaps if the game gave me a chance to meet him before he went missing I would have cared a little more about his well being. The loopy old monk and asian guide were the only memorable characters in my opinion. The twist the game threw at me three quarters of the way through the game was nice, but apart from that I'd say the story was mediocre at best.

[u][b]Audio:[/b][/u]
Although I believe the soundtrack was of a perfect fit for the game and of a much higher quality than most hidden object game soundtracks, I wouldn't say that it was anything special. And the voice acting was as stereotypical as they come.

[u][b]Verdict:[/b][/u]
Compared to other hidden object games you get a lot more content than you normally would. The different asian inspired environments are well drawn and pleasing to look at. The character animations could use a bit of work, but the hidden object/puzzle games are all of high quality and that's what really matters. I'd personally say it's worth it's full asking price, but it frequently drops down to 90% off though, so save your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313085750', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1532713155}
review:
Non vi mentirò, sono partito molto prevenuto per questo gioco poichè è uno di quei giochi la cui key è spesso regalata e si è unito alla discarica di giochi da 50 centesimi che ti tirano in faccia, per questo l'ho tenuto in libreria a prendere polvere per molti mesi, qualche giorno fa avendo finito i giochi a mia disposizione ho deciso di guardare un po' cosa avevo in libreria e ho trovato questo.
Una piccola perla contenente miriadi di puzzle differenti di varia difficoltà, una trama tutto sommato carina e degli achievement parecchio ironici da ottenere (primo fra tutti "trova il pisello magico" lol).
Il gioco non è molto lungo (5-6 ore massimo) però offre un buon livello di sfida, gli enigmi sono troppo fini a sè stessi e fin troppo forzati, dovrai fare cose completamente senza senso logico e troverai cose assurde nei posti più strambi, ad aiutarci in questo ci sono degli aiuti praticamente illimitati con un piccolo cooldown tra l'uno e l'altro che ammetto di aver utilizzato mooooooooolto spesso non essendo il mio genere di giochi.
Serve molta astuzia e logica ma allo stesso tempo penso che nessuno riuscirebbe a finirlo senza utilizzare qualche aiuto poichè come detto prima ci sono situazioni completamente illogiche, non è un punto negativo però perché essendoci la disponibilità degli aiuti il gioco scorre molto piacevolmente.
Anche i filmati e le ambientazioni sono fatti molto bene.
Per un gioco da 90 centesimi è più di quello che ci si potrebbe aspettare, consigliatissimo per passare una manciata di ore di spensieratezza al costo di un caffè.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191245169', 'num_games_owned': 422, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1523455729}
review:
一款合格的传统解谜游戏，支持中文，部分解谜的内容没有什么逻辑性和线索可寻，一些地方需要XJB点，剧情上没有什么亮点，虽然是中文版，不过玩通了之后我还是对它说的故事没什么印象。
       原价入太贵，折扣到10元以下这款游戏会成为很不错的选择。另外因为我对解谜游戏的剧情性和游戏性要求比较高，所以让我一个人玩我是玩不下去的，比较适合和（女）朋友一起玩，即便是在非常休闲的状态下也只需要5小时左右就可以通关游戏，如果看提示会更快。
       总而言之，虽然我说了这个游戏很多缺点，但是他作为一款休闲时玩的传统解谜游戏还是不错的（如果几块钱的话）。

author: {'steamid': '76561198013848655', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1532085554}
review: I enjoyed the original more than the bonus game, but I have to say I got sick of walking around the map trying to work out what I was supposed to do, so I used the hint button a lot. The puzzles were good, some more challenging than others, and the storyline is a cack. The crazy monk is the highlight, and the cheesy romance. Worth a couple of bucks, but I wouldn't pay $10 for any hidden object game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198220532600', 'num_games_owned': 1403, 'num_reviews': 298, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1622557583}
review:
[h1]《Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold Collector's Edition》[/h1]

[quote=An.]
叽咪叽咪评测师招募中，免费领KEY[url=https://jq.qq.com/?_wv=1027&k=5fHaxv2]点击加入叽咪评测团[/url]
图文评测首发于[url=https://www.gimmgimm.com/article/info?id=13045]叽咪叽咪[/url]
喜欢请关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/27162873/]叽咪叽咪鉴赏家[/url]
[/quote]

Point and Click Adventure（P＆C）是解谜类游戏中的重要分支之一，游戏的核心玩法在于扮演故事中的主角，与周边的环境、物品、人物互动，在场景转换、物品组合中解开各种谜题，并且根据各种动画CG、物品日志等熟知剧情。可以说，一个好的点击解密类游戏无非有两个优点，其一在于出色的剧情设定可以弱化解谜元素，如《Dark Parables(黑暗寓言)》，其二在于有趣的解谜游戏可以弱化剧情，如《the Room(未上锁的房间)》。
在这样一种背景下，我本来以为《Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold Collector's Edition》（《梅丽莎K的勇敢之旅》）也不过是一个诸如此类的游戏，真正玩起来之后才发现大有不同。

[h1]涉及到拉玛坚史诗背景[/h1]
拉玛坚是由印度史诗罗摩衍那派生出来的泰国史诗，主要讲述了毗湿奴神因要除掉一个魔王而转生成人类名为拉玛，在长大后妻子被魔王掳走，于是拉玛带领军队，借助海神的帮助，经过恶战，最终杀死了魔王，取得了胜利。
《MK.&HoG》的故事背景，正是一位女博士出于兴趣前来调查这一历史，之后的剧情古今交错，既可以看到现代泰国佛教建筑的庄严肃穆，又可以看到公元前三世纪的风雨飘摇。
只从这一剧情涉及的内容上，就比那些千篇一律的吸血鬼、僵尸来的恢弘大气，引人入胜。如果编排一下剧本，可以说单纯从剧情角度出发，它就已经站在一个很高的位置上，但无奈拥有一手好牌却没有打好。在拉玛坚史诗背景下，游戏还是从小角度切入，在女博士调查的过程中，又发现了自己和传说中千丝万缕的联系，从发现了导游的阴谋到最终历经千辛万险破坏他的计划，总感觉像是高屋建瓴后的小桥流水人家。虽然在剧情上有着较为完整的勾连，但是从史诗一下跌入到悬疑电视剧级别，不免让人心里有种落差。

[h1]可以较自由的拖动视角[/h1]
在我玩过的大部分3D点击解谜游戏中，切换场景的方式仍然是点击屏幕边缘。在《MK.&HoG》中，虽然切换不同大场景仍然需要点击屏幕边缘，但是同一场景内却加入了卷轴效果，玩家可以在一定视角范围内自由拖动屏幕查看不同区域，来找到隐藏的路径或者物品。
当我第一次拖动视角发现了一些新东西之后，还是小小的惊叹了一下。即使这一点或许在别的游戏中显得平平无奇，还是能让解谜游戏的游戏体验变的更加平滑和流畅。

[h1]细腻精致的UI和日志[/h1]
看惯了太多粗糙的UI，这款游戏的设计真是让我眼前一亮。
我们可以看到本地化做的极好的信件、说明等要素。要知道这些内容本身也是游戏解谜的重要一环，虽然大部分情况下玩家哪怕不注意这些日志也能通关，但如果想还原一个完整的剧情，这些元素又是必不可少的。而出色的纸张效果、精致的文字设计，足以吸引一些想完整了解剧情的玩家去分析在表面故事下掩盖的细枝末节。

[h1]新颖有趣的小游戏体验[/h1]
点击解谜游戏的游戏内容主要由按照提示找物品和一些小游戏组成。当你玩过很多同类型游戏之后，你会发现其实小游戏的类型就那么几种，拼图/拼纸、接水管、安齿轮、解绳子、反射等等，可以说触一类而百行通。而在《MK.&HoG》中，虽然也不可避免的有这些经典类型的小游戏，但还有很多新颖的小游戏让人眼前一亮。
除了这些小游戏，游戏还有类似于《古墓丽影》中的检查文物来获取新线索的形式。
可以说这些难度不高、数量又不少的小游戏，在整个游戏过程中，很好的调剂了玩家的口味和心情。

[h1]拥有多周目游戏的价值[/h1]
衡量一个roguelike游戏的重要标准之一，就是有没有足够吸引玩家无限玩下去的闪光点。而《MK.&HoG》作为一个点击解谜游戏，恰恰有着这一亮点。
首先成就中的收集要素，就可以让玩家来回晚上几个周目去寻找。
最重要的一点在于小游戏的排行榜系统。
我们可以看到，在一个小游戏完成之后，会显示出你的用时和STEAM记录在案的排行榜上的最佳时间，这激励着玩家一次次的挑战记录，来获得比“解开谜题”更进一步的“超越他人和自己”的快乐和满足感，这是一般小游戏所无法给玩家带来的独特体验。

[h1]致命的缺点[/h1]
这个缺点就在于，作为一个解谜游戏，在解谜内容的安排上流畅性不够，也就是其解谜逻辑不够严谨，玩家经常玩着玩着就不知道下一个目标在哪，只能依赖于提示。而过度依赖提示就导致玩家的参与感降低，使游戏变成了一个过场电影一般。
我在进行二周目，甚至三周目的游玩时，还是会出现经常忘了下一步该去哪，该做什么，而我只是想做几个成就而已。
还有一个致命缺点在于，游戏给了玩家重玩价值的是小游戏，不是整个剧情，所以如果玩家想挑战某一个小游戏的排行榜，只要不断SL在这个小游戏前面的进度就可以了对吧，但是接下来就是这个游戏最蠢的一点了，那就是它只有一个存档位置。你想玩这一个小游戏，就不得不从头到尾全玩一遍，这一设定只会让玩家感到冗长、拖沓。

author: {'steamid': '76561198007660744', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 680, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 680, 'last_played': 1528931277}
review: The story and characters are very bad, in a cheesy way, and there are a lot of puzzles that follow insane moon logic. I actually liked this game though, as some puzzles are interesting and the Hidden Object parts are rather calming. It is also not [i]too[/i] hard and there is a help system you can use if you get stuck. Overall I'll give it a weak recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041316901', 'num_games_owned': 726, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1528055822}
review: The game is beautiful but very unintuitive, I simply do not understand what I should do next. And there is a minigame which is hard to win and cannot be skipped.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126610501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 1610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1610, 'last_played': 1522398527}
review: From the intro and the very beginning of the game, it’s obvious that the creators had a great ambition: a HOG-adventure game in exotic setting, lots of puzzles and Indiana Jones-like story. The final game may have fallen short of that ambition, but I’d still classify it as an above-average HOG, mainly due to the large number of puzzles and high-quality HO scenes. Those, and the puzzles, can be also played outside the main game, which is useful for getting all the achievements (some of which are bordering on the insane). The main problem I had was with the controls – items collected in the inventory can be applied only by drag&drop, which is not always comfortable. But overall this is a good game, and at a favorable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963377064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 402, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1526155491}
review:
The amount of work done is amazing, artistically and technically.
I have played MANY hidden object games BUT like someone else stated:
"There are objects you won't find in a million years and puzzles you won't solve not because they're difficult, but because you will wonder what the heck are you supposed to do".
You just have to use the help button to move forward, then you end pushing it all the times cause you completely lose interest in the game.
I'm french and this game is done by a french team so i really would have liked to "plus" this game, but i'm sorry that's the 1st hidden object game i can't recommend unless you like to push the help button to move forward :-( :-(

author: {'steamid': '76561198084965708', 'num_games_owned': 460, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1520293840}
review:
Le positif : un jeu d'objets cachés qui fonctionne bien, je n'ai pas de bugs à signaler, il y a une histoire bonus, je n'ai pas vu de probleme avec la traduction. Il a une bonne durée de jeu pour ce type de jeu. Il y ades changements dans les décors selon la partie du jeu que j'ai trouvé plutot bien fait au niveau de l'ambiance.

Le négatif : Les enigmes etaient relativement faciles mais assez répétitives. J'ai tourné en rond par moment car il fallait retourner parler à un personnage par moment alors que ce n'était pas du tout indiquer ou que rien ne laissait parfois penser qu'il fallait parler ENCORE à ce personnage (parfois plusieurs fois comme le religieux à qui on doit parler BEAUCOUP). 

En résumé, l'histoire n'était pas transcendante mais c'est tout à fait jouable, ca passe le temps. Je l'ai acheté en solde à 2 ou 3euros, je recommande d'attendre les prochaines promos et de ne pas l'acheter au prix fort car il est agréable sans plus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056427499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1521304879}

author: {'steamid': '76561198290445268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1520926333}
review:
Primeiramente, joguei apenas alguns minutos, o restante do tempo foi para pegar as cartas. Desisti logo de cara por um "problema" simples, normalmente em jogos de Objeto Oculto ou Point-and-click você fica passeando com o mouse pela tela e aquilo que pode ser interagido é destacado de alguma maneira, porém em Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold Collector's Edition isso não ocorre e você precisa clicar em tudo. Outro fator que agrava a situação é o fato de você conseguir "girar em 360°", usando o mouse é possivel arrastar a tela e enxergar os outros lados, isso é bem interessante, mas como não existe destaque naquilo que pode ser interagido, esse elemento serve apenas para aumentar o trabalho em encontrar as coisas.
Resumindo, apesar desse detalhe ser pequeno faz uma diferença enorme ao jogo e com certeza afeta bastante na jogatina, portanto não recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075274719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1520605765}
review:
[h1]장점 [/h1]
+ 동아시아가 무대다

[h1]단점 [/h1]
- 개연성이 없는 퍼즐
- 부실한 게임 속 정보
- 재미 없는 스토리
- 아쉬운 한글화 퀄리티

[h1]평점 [/h1]
2/10

게임성 3/10
스토리 2/10
영상미 2/10 

[h1]퍼즐 풀다가 사리가 생긴다 [/h1]
포인트 앤 클릭 어드벤쳐 장르의 게임인 멜리사 그리고 황금 심장은 마치 인디아나 존스를 패러디한듯한 여성 고고학자 멜리사가 주인공인 게임이다. 이 게임의 몇 없는 장점은 태국이 무대라는 점이다. 실제 존재하는지 모르겠지만 태국의 신화에 관련된 내용이 나오는데 이러한 내용을 보는 것이 이 게임에서 얻을 수 있는 거의 유일한 장점이다.

이 게임에서 가장 불편한 점은 포인트 앤 클릭 방식을 취하고 있는데 게임에 대한 힌트를 전혀 주지 않는 다는 점이다. 물론 이러한 장르의 게임에 있는 강제적인 도우미 기능이 우측 하단에 있지만 이 기능은 정말 최종적으로 퍼즐에 막혔을 때 사용해야 하는 시스템이지 게임이 막힐 때 마다 사용하는 기능이 아니다. 

보통 이러한 장르의 게임은 플레이어가 마우스를 이용해 다양한 오브젝트를 선택하고 정보를 얻고 게임의 힌트를 얻어나가야 하는데도 불구하고 이 게임은 아무리 클릭질을 해봐도 게임에 대한 힌트를 주지 않는다. 

힌트를 주지 않는 다는 뜻이 쓸모없는 정보를 준다는 뜻이 아니라 말 그대로 정말 아무 텍스트가 뜨지 않는다.

말 그대로 아이템을 줍거나 문을 찾을 때 까지 허공에다가 무한 클릭을 해야한다는 이야기다. 이러한 플레이가 재미가 없는 이유는  다양한 오브젝트에서 얻는 정보도 없이 그냥  제작진이 의도한 스토리만 주구장창 강제적으로 보는게 이 게임의 전부라는 뜻이기 때문인데 이럴러면 그냥 대사만 클릭하고 영상만 쭈르륵 나오게 하지 왜 포인트 클릭 어드벤쳐 방식으로 만들었는지 의문이 든다.

추리를 하는 상황에서도 상당히 문제점을 가지고 있는데 가장 큰 문제는 수수께끼에 개연성이 없다. 보이지도 않는 벽을 닦으면 보물이 나오고 뜬금없이 바닥에 진행에 중요한 아이템들이 떨궈져 있다. 진열장에 잡동사니들을 정리하면 갑자기 건전지 배터리가 완성되고 태국의 소형 택시인 본네트를 마사지 해주면 수리가 되는 형식이다.

퍼즐 요소도 마찬가지다. 화면에 찾아야할 대상을 너무나 정신 없이 흩뿌려놓아서 관찰과 추리를 하기 보다는 그냥 허공에 클릭질 하는게 더 빠르기 때문이다. 그나마 퍼즐이 그럭저럭 할만하다는 점이 다행이다.

플레이타임이 짧을 것이라는 희망을 가지고 플레이했지만 생각보다 길었다는 점도 너무 힘들었다. 한글화의 퀄리티도 번역체의 느낌이 나서 아쉬웠다.

스토리는 아무래도 상관없으니 포인트 앤 클릭류 퍼즐을 좋아하는 사람이라면 모르겠지만 그다지 추천하고 싶지 않은 게임이다.

review: El juego esta bueno para pasar el rato, la banda sonora es interesante y los puzzles no son precisamente dificiles, el problema de este juego es que se torna aburrido conforme mas tiempo lo juegas, constantemente tienes que buscar objetos atravez de todos los escenarios para luego volver a uno casi del principio y utilizarlo, realmente no te enteras de nada en muchas ocasiones ni aunque revises el diario y veas los objetivos, y estoy seguro que ha muchos jugadores les costara realmente terminar este juego sin utilizar el boton de ayuda cada 1 minuto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018450069', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 597, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1518920207}
review:
Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold Collector's Edition (gigantic name) is a fantastic puzzle game. 
I was with low expectations about the game, because of the genre, but I was impressed at the end. Even start to replay it again for the achievements.

It's challenging, is fun, is diverse. Lots of puzzles, hidden objects challenges and secrets to find.
The story is ok and honestly I don't stay for it. 

Graphically nothing impress, but I enjoy the art style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356141989', 'num_games_owned': 2521, 'num_reviews': 637, 'playtime_forever': 2539, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1519738853}
review:
This one is what I call a great hidden object/puzzle game, with everything in its right place and soothing graphics that on one hand don't require much to any kind of PC but on the other hand they are always awesomely drawn and positioned (details and zooming included) and let the game run super fast without blocks of any sort!
Plus, this adventure is set into a '40s Thailand with lots of Oriental elements that aren't so easy to find in this genre, since it often focuses on fantasy themes or generally speaking, "Western" settings. And this means of course that there are lots of hints and themes drawn from the Buddhist tradition and the South-Eastern Asian culture!
The game also supports different difficulty settings and offers lots of hours of gameplay, has a great hint and recharge system, lots of different locations (more than 30) and lots of puzzles, among of course the usual hidden object adventure, so that you'll have to collect items, store them or combine into your inventory in order to proceed and so on, as a point 'n' cick game.
Maybe the plot and the NPCs aren't that awesome, but still everything's enjoyable and smooth and you won't give much attention to the small "errors", if I can call them like this, but long games like this one of course can't be perfect for every hint, every puzzle, every small object and such. It's overall really great, possibly one of the most interesting and entertaining adventure hidden object puzzle games here on Steam.
Plus, I found the puzzles (which are abundant but never "annoying" in my opinion, they're almost all put in the right places and situations) quite challenging and funny, and some of them are also definitely hard! And the game's also continuously saved, so that you can exit whenever you want without checkpoints and your progress will always be saved :)
If you're wondering what the difficulty settings are about, I'll try to give you a general view: the easy option gives you an easier time in the hidden object sequences with no penalties for wrong clicks, plus you'll have shiny zones displayed in order to reach the areas and fast reload times and so on. The medium option is the standard one, while the expert difficulty settings will bring you no help text at all, no skip buttons for riddles, penalties and very hard puzzles overall.
The main menu screen has moreover a great extra section in which you'll be able to view cinematics, replay puzzles only or hidden object sections, view artworks, collectibles and hear the soundtrack!
Oh, I've got also another tip to say: unfortunately, the game runs automatically in your native Steam client's language - Italian in my case - but the language chance isn't implemented into Steam. Luckily, the developers have posted an announcement years ago in which they tell you the procedure you need to do if you wanna play it in English (completely recommended, since unfortunately as always the local translations are often crappy and filled with big errors). The procedure is very simple and requires you to create a txt file in the game's folder and write into it the language you prefer, so simply "English" for instance.
I can't say that this is a downside, since all the localized games unfortunately are almost always crappy when it comes to the actual translation.. so if a non native English speaker kid wants to play this in his native tongue (the game "supports" 14 languages overall) well, he will be in front of a poor translation.
But this is the case of.. every game. From the most expensive Final Fantasy titles to the small simple indie ones. So, this small workaround is needed in order to change the language and well, it's better to keep it in English trust me :)
Ok, I finished with my lesson of today ahah, back to the game quickly!
As I was saying, everything runs smoothly and the navigation's fast, I've encountered no bugs in moving the objects, running around the screens and so on. 
Yay, 9€ is too much, but you can find it on sales and it's worth 1 or 2€ or even more, it really has much replaying value due to the length of the game, the number of puzzles, the difficulty settings and also the fact that you can replay and see again cinematics (there's voice acting too!), tracks and such in the main menu!
So, this may not be a masterpiece but in this field it's one of the best titles I've played on Steam in my opinion. I get many of the points that other players pointed out (keep though in mind that this game came out years ago, and the developers fixed many bugs - between 2017 and 2018, I've encountered no bugs at all for what concerns what I read in 2014 or 2015 reviews), but as of today if found on some kind of sale it's great to play, entertaining, challenging and also suitable for kids, since the story isn't that scary or deep, but still it's enjoyable and of course we're here for the puzzles, the adventure and the hidden objects and not for dialogues or novel elements, otherwise I'd return to the university but no thanks, I've already given out too much in history and literature. Ok I know this isn't relevant for the review.. XD But in my opinion the story overall is enjoyable, not the best plot I've ever seen but it fits well and maybe only the NPC elements could have received more attention, but this isn't a big deal for me given the good quality of the game.
I've also got to add that everyone told me that this is a big homage to the Indiana Jones franchise, but unfortunately I've never watched it so yeah, may be xD
If you like hidden object adventures, and if you like riddles and puzzles with the option to change the whole game to a hard ("expert") rate, you'll find yourself playing lots of hours here. And since the developers fixed all the bugs in and outside the game (for what concerns the achievements), there's nothing really to complain about. Just play it in English with that little workaround, since languages such as Italian and French are quite bad (and overall, the voices and such will always be in English).
Plus, the Collector Edition adds another chapter to the game (you'll have to choose directly from the main menu, play normally or play the C.E.), which you will play with another protagonist (you'll see by playing as Melissa! Don't play the C.E. before xD) and you'll have also a strategy guide at your disposal. It's a way shorter chapter, but still a great plus to the game.
I think that with all the fixes and all the attention it had, this game is a really solid addition in your hidden object/puzzle adventure library and can also be enjoyed by kids or players not that accustomed to the genre (due to the easy setting and the hint system, plus there's also a diary in which everything will be written as you go on!), so put it into your wishlist and have fun :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328736', 'num_games_owned': 3959, 'num_reviews': 727, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1515945518}
review:
Jeu d'aventure parsemé de puzzles, d'énigmes et d'objets cachés dans lequel on incarne une aventurière dans un périple en Thaïlande.


D'entrée, le jeu se distingue des autres jeux du genre par son ambition dans les graphismes.
De bonnes cinématiques, de jolis environnements, de l'animation dans la transition entre les plans, la possibilité de bouger la caméra dans certains lieux et parfois d'examiner un objet en 3D. On en oublie facilement les animations perfectibles et les textures obsolètes qui ne nuisent pas au plaisir du jeu.

Quant au gameplay, il est inhabituellement riche pour une jeu de ce style. 
On doit découvrir des objets utiles à l'aventure, résoudre des énigmes et réussir des petits jeux. On est agréablement surpris par la variété, l'originalité et la richesse des défis proposés. A plusieurs occasions, on doit réaliser des mouvements particuliers avec la souris pour réussir une action.
On dispose d'un inventaire, d'une carte (pour faciliter les déplacements d'un lîeu à l'autre) et d'un journal de bord qui rassemble des notes sur notre progression, une liste actualisée de nos objectifs, des documents récoltés qui enrichissent la narration et les trophées débloqués. 
Les voix sont en anglais mais les sous-titres sont en français.

Le jeu a facilement une durée de vie d'au moins 10h, à moins naturellement d'avoir recours au système d'indices et de solutions compris dans le jeu. Malheureusement, ce n'est pas tant pour la richesse du jeu que pour ses éléments de gameplay qui compliquent la progression. 
En effet, le curseur ne change jamais d'apparence pour signaler une action possible et il faut donc trouver non seulement les objets à utiliser ou les actes à entreprendre mais également les endroits correspondants. Ce qui est possible dans un simple jeu d'objets cachés simpliste devient ici une vraie difficulté tant les décors sont riches en détails et en cachettes discrètes. Si les objets qu'on récolte ont pratiquement tous une utilisation logique et cohérente, encore faut-il les trouver. Souvent, il faudra au préalable employer notre torche pour inspecter les recoins, inspecter l'horizon avec notre longue-vue ou envoyer notre petit gecko explorer des trous de souris. Il y a vraiment des choses pas aisées à repérer. On se retrouve donc vite à cliquer un peu partout sur l'écran de peur de passer à côté de quelque chose. Le problème est que cette façon de jouer est punie dans tout le jeu comme dans les SOC : une série trop rapide de clics infructueux provoque une brouillage de l'écran durant quelques secondes. Il peut alors devenir agaçant de chercher à déterminer si telle zone d'ombre cache un mystère, si telle tiroir peut être ouvert ou si tel objet est récupérable.

Si je n'ai pas parlé du scénario, c'est parce que ce n'est pas forcément le point fort du jeu. Non pas parce que l'histoire est superficielle mais parce qu'au contraire elle est plutôt confuse tant on veut nous raconter de choses différentes. Au départ, on veut simplement explorer les environs pour retrouver un jeune moine qui a disparu. On va visiter une bibliothèque, des temples, la jungle, une maison hantée ; on va faire de la moto et du bateau ; on va être accompagné de notre guide et de notre vieil ami Julian ; ça va parler pêle-mêle de visions, de prédictions, de Buddha, de réincarnation, de légendes, de croyances, de dieux, de malédictions, de médecine alternative, de musique, de peinture, de statues et même de clonage.
Melissa est davantage une version féminine d'Indiana Jones que la petite soeur de Lara Croft mais elle est véritablement l'héroïne et Julian le simple faire-valoir et c'est lui qui a tous les attributs habituels de la potiche blonde énamourée, candide (et fan d'astrologie dans le bonus).

Cette version nous permet de jouer à un bonus en incarnant l'ami Julian pendant un épisode qui se déroule pendant l'histoire principale.



Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold, c'est un titre qui hésite entre le point&click casual et le jeu de puzzles et objets cachés qui a probalement de la peine à trouver son public car il sera trop ardu et trop long pour ceux qui ne pourront pas se passer ds indices et il sera frustrant pour les amateurs d'histoires d'aventure. Néanmoins, il propose des défis variés qu'on ne soupçonne pas forcément est c'est pour moi plutôt une bonne surprise.

review: Achievement hunters beware - there is a falling bricks puzzle that if you cannot complete, you cannot proceed and get other achievements. This type of puzzle belongs in an arcade style game, not a hidden object game. There is NO skip - if you can't do this stupid arcade style puzzle it's end of game. I cannot recommend this in a HOG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170481649', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1514086866}
review:
游戏的背景定为现代考古博士的神秘亚洲之旅，讲述的是泰国风味的宗教探险故事。

首先：
场景精美，探索丰富；
角色对话有配音，游戏字幕自带中文；
解谜小游戏众多，游戏场景可以有限拖动，带来不错的游玩乐趣；
游戏中有难度设定，提示也比较健全，不必担心会有焦躁的卡关感受；
针对排行榜爱好者专门设定了一个成就统计系统，供玩家对小游戏时间和准确率不断发起挑战。
[spoiler] （游戏中还有根据曲谱敲钟的关卡，对于刚开始学打鼓我的我来说勉强给个好评？）[/spoiler] ← （请无视我）

然而：
或许是对东南亚的文化缺乏了解，游戏中部分剧情常常让我一头雾水，谜题线索也让我感到莫名其妙。至于剧情逻辑...题材都已经点名是神话故事，我想对逻辑什么的还是不应该有要求。作为一个解谜游戏，无法吸引我关注的剧情大概是让我最不满意的地方。过场动画的剪辑也相对僵硬，不过考虑到游戏的重点并不在此，倒也算不上十分难受的缺点（制作组贴心的增加了跳过按键）。

最后：
在诸多同类型游戏中算是游玩质量还不错，特价入手十分实惠，给个好评吧。
如果是喜欢剧情解谜向的朋友可能会失望，将它当作一个带游戏交互功能的神话故事连环画来看，还是相当精美的一款作品。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1513658049}
review:
https://youtu.be/JIoMoV4PNOQ

The plot may be unclear and poorly acted out in cut scenes, but the actual game play of this hidden object / adventure game offers a lot of variety that keeps the experience feeling fresh.  It's best played on lower difficulty not for the puzzles, but for the lack of guidance when navigating the world to figure out where to go next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017862044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1513955729}
review: Started out promising, but the story quickly becomes incoherent and the puzzles so illogical that I was more-or-less spamming the hint button by the end.  Even the hidden object scenes have some weaksauce pixel-hunts where the object you're looking for can be behind other objects with no indication.  Wish they'd put as much effort into the gameplay as the cutscenes and panorama.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966880438', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1541355444}
review:
Melissa K. & The Heart of Gold ist ein wunderschönes Point&Click-Abenteuer mit einer einzigartigen, interaktiven 3D-Welt und mysteriösen Puzzles.

Freue Dich auf ein Spielerlebnis, das Dich nicht so schnell loslassen wird.

Die Geschichte spielt in Thailand im Jahr 1947 und enthält Charaktere, Mythen und Legenden 
aus dortigen volkstümlichen und buddhistischen Geschichten. Du musst auch Intrigen und Verschwörungen aufdecken, um alle Rätsel lösen zu können.

Als Melissa von der Königin von England eingeladen wird, hat sie keine Ahnung, 
dass sich dadurch ihr Leben dramatisch verändern wird. Eine am Anfang einfach klingende Mission führt dazu, dass ihre grundlegende Existenz in Frage gestellt wird. 

Du übernimmst die Rolle der Melissa, die versucht, das Rätsel um das Verschwinden des jungen Mönchs aufzudecken.

Viele Schauplätze im Spiel, durch die Du Dich navigieren musst, beinhalten Rätsel und komplette Minispiele, bei deren Lösung Punkte gesammelt werden können und Du dadurch auch im Spiel weiter kommst. 

Du kannst das Spiel in verschiedenen Schwierigkeitsstufen spielen, so das auch Deine kleine Schwester oder Dein kleiner Bruder miträtseln können.

Meine Tochter, 8 Jahre, war begeistert und hat nicht eher Ruhe gelassen, bis wir das Spiel geschafft hatten.

Die Grafik ist sehr schön und zusammen mit der Vertonung ein rundum gelungenes Spielepaket.
Alle Schauplätze und die Filmsequenzen sind detailliert, grafisch gut umgesetzt und versetzen Dich in eine mystische Stimmung.

Wieder ein Point&Click-Adventure, zu dem ich nur sagen kann, wenn es im Angebot ist, kaufen und Spaß haben. 
Ein Spiel für die ganze Familie, wobei Groß und Klein ihren Spaß haben werden.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307225540', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1510466398}
review:
[h1]Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold Collector's Edition ужасная игра.[/h1]
Я не особый любитель Жанра "Я ищу",но то что эта игра плохая,может понять любой кто поиграет в нее.
Я знаю что от таких игр чего то бомбезного ждать не нужно,но ведь если сыграть в другие игры этого жанра,ты понимаешь что эта игра сыра даже для таких игр.
Начнем с того что в этой игре по просту тебе приходится тыкать по всему Экрану,дабы собрать случайный предмет,который на фоне всего не кажется нужным тебе.В игре всего один вид курсора мыши,это палец.И фиг ты поймешь какую зону можно осмотреть,а с какой взаимодействовать.Обычно в играх этого жанра 3 вида курсора,лупа - для осмотра территории,рука - для поднятия предмета и просто курсор.Так в этой игре только палец.
Это очень неудобно,и иногда ты просто не понимаешь что тебе нужно взять,А что осмотреть.А что и вовсе декорация.
Приходится жмякать на кнопку подсказки,благо она тут есть.
Сюжет бредовый,но наблюдать за ним интересно.Когда появляется персонаж мужского пола,начинается санта-барбара.Это не круто.
Персонажи не расскрыты,понравился только старичек,	[spoiler]да и то его под конец слили.	[/spoiler]
Интересный Дневник героя,записки,Секреты и блаблабла,В общем читать это интересно.
Имеется Бонусный сюжет,рассказывающий о напарнике Главной героини,в целом ничего интересного не заключает,лишь новую особенность решения загадок  с помощью подзорной трубы.
Кривая анимация кат-сцен.ОЧЕНЬ КРИВАЯ.
Под конец игры,надоедает поиск предметов и локаций,приходится пользоваться подсказкой,дабы быстрее закончить.
	[spoiler]Понравилась отсылка на Индиану джонса с:	[/spoiler]
Ну,в общем то и все,положительных моментов меньше,чем отрицательных.Поэтому игру я не рекомендую,сам бы не купил,но спасибо INDI GALA за раздачу:D

review:
...한글화는 정말 고맙습니다.
그런데...한국인이 내용파악못할 엉터리 스토리 번역은...아쉽네요...
게임진행은 무리가없지만 스토리 동영상의 가치는 0으로 떨어집니다...
번역된 단어가 도무지 말이안되며 순서도 ....
전설의 왈도채보다는 괜찬지만 퍼즐의 힌트나 스토리의 번역이 말이 안되서...
퍼즐난이도는 급상승하고 스토리는 이해가 안되서...그냥 숨은그림찾기 느낌입니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331968037', 'num_games_owned': 2028, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1509538209}
review:
По сравнению с подобными играми от артифекс мунди - какая то недоделка. Подсказка нужна практически везде, ибо логика происходящего отсутствует напрочь. Особенно доставляет ящерица - куда и в какую дыру ее надо отправить ни разу самостоятельно ниасилил. 
При всем при этом нарисовано вполне прилично. Картинка удалась

author: {'steamid': '76561198130262111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1508161979}
review:
¡¡¡¡TRUÑO DE VIDEOJUEGO!!!!
Este videojuego de búsqueda de objetos, es literalmente una “GRAN ADREIM”. Es malísimo.
Esto es lo que no me ha gustado:
1)	Su historia está muy mal contada. Hasta tal manera, que debes consultar los apuntes del diario, para entender la trama.
2)	Los doblajes son pésimos, pero auténticamente penosos. Ya pueden contar un acontecimiento que motiva a tener un estado de emoción (sorpresa, tristeza, etc), que los actores lo han doblado planamente, sin transmitir nada. Es decir, como si estuvieran leyendo un libro aburrido de matemáticas.
3)	La traducción al español, posee erratas.
4)	El control de inspeccionar zonas es malísimo, nada lógico de saber si son accesibles o hay que buscar algo allí.
5)	Muchas veces no sabes que tienes que hacer, porque como no se cuenta bien las cosas. Por lo que debes actuar inspeccionando los lugares y probar cosas, a ver si te has dejado algo por alto. 
6)	La utilización de los objetos en un lugar, deben ser exactas. Es decir, debes coger el objeto y meterlo de manera exacta donde corresponde. Algo muy malo, ya que si lo haces rápido, y ves que no ha funcionado, te da por descartar, que no hay nada que hacer en ese lugar.

Lo único que me ha gustado:
1)	Algunos de sus puzles, son bastantes originales.
2)	El contenido extra, es bastante interesante.
3)	Que el juego posea cromos y logros Steam.

En definitiva, no recomiendo para nada este juego. 
Si te gustan los juegos de “Búsquedas de Objetos”, te recomiendo los del estudio “Artifex Mundi”, que son buenos y están a muy buen precio. Por 1€ puedes hacerte con varios en un bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198396849986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1580188613}
review: 一款很不错的游戏，解密也挺有趣！不过对新手而言，需要无尽的提示，因为这游戏东西摆放很乱，不是像那些再图上乱点就行的，可能东西不光再临近的图，也有可能再其他的板块里，这是游戏的一大难点，也是乐趣点～总体而言是赞的！新手可以先玩支线剧情再攻略主线，这样有助于破解和熟悉地图！

author: {'steamid': '76561198128780643', 'num_games_owned': 592, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1456163220}
review:
Mediocre.
Los puzzles están bien, muy simples y repetitivos, pero efectivos en su contexto. Su apartado artístico se me hace muy agradable, ciertos fondos son bellísimos y muy detallados. y te puedes reír por lo patética que es la historia.
y... aquí terminan los puntos buenos.

Para ser un juego simple y bastante fácil de completar (4 horas en mi caso) es muy aburrido. 
La historia que nos quieren contar aquí está muy mal ejecutada, y los personajes son igual de aburridos y planos como la jugabilidad.
Las cinemáticas, que deberían adentrarnos en el mundo y en su historia, sólo logran alejarnos de cualquier tipo de incersión por lo flojas que son.
No hay curva de dificultad ni de aprendizaje, el juego tiene un sistema de pistas que arruina cualquier tipo de pensamiento o uso de neuronas. Si, es algo opcional, pero está ahí... y el juego no es difícil. Por lo que, aunque entiendo el por qué lo hicieron, se me hace completamente innecesario.

Si te aburres y te lo regalaron o lo sacaste gratis de alguna página... juégalo, no pierdes mucho tiempo. 
Pero no lo compres, no vale la pena gastar tu dinero aquí.
