author: {'steamid': '76561198007688772', 'num_games_owned': 1263, 'num_reviews': 649, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1427664816}
review: Rozporuplná hra. Na jedné straně oslní skvělou grafikou a hlavně úžasným pseudo-3D pohledem, kterým strká veškerou konkurenci do kapsy. Hlavolamy a hledání skrytých objektů je tentokrát také pestré a povedené. Na druhé straně otráví neintuitivním používáním předmětů, neustálým pixel huntingem a občas zcela neviditelnými aktivními zónami. Hinty jsou tentokrát nezbytností. Přesto mírný palec nahoru.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102894290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 97, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1427570326}
review:
It's more of adventure game with some puzzle and hidden object  thrown in than the reverse. My biggest complain is the hidden object element itself. Rather than giving you a list of things to find, they show you the items you need to find (usually pieces of puzzle) making it just click anything that looks any bit out of place. The graphic is pretty, and I like the animation/3d effect. But on the other hand you can really feel that this game is made for touch pad. Too much click-hold and dragging for computer user. And you can't change the language in game. All in all I guess this is good for little kids with ipad, but maybe not for steam users or even HOG/Adventure game players. 

Btw the horror element is decent though, the dev should make a horror game. Featuring the gecko, preferably.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105680429', 'num_games_owned': 5132, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1427450366}
review: “Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold Collector's Edition”中文名叫"梅丽莎与黄金之心"（当然了不叫勇敢之旅估计很多人误以为叫这个呢=- =），游戏亮点在于CG动画，然后配上不错的剧情足矣显示这游戏是多么的棒了，这游戏音乐做的很不错，游戏中探索谜题解锁发现任务，还有丰富的小游戏，耐玩度很高，完成解锁可以在额外部分里观看欣赏解锁的内容，而且这游戏自带中文还经常进过慈善包，所以大家还不快来尝试下这款游戏，绝对不会让你失望~

author: {'steamid': '76561198058872911', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1427039822}
review: 是个很不错的游戏。  自带中文， 好评！  音乐也不错。游戏结合了动作，解密，合作，对话，点击，恋爱，收藏，恐怖，独立，冒险，休闲于一体 再结合游戏本身的内涵品质 ，是近几年来  难得的佳作

author: {'steamid': '76561198046407276', 'num_games_owned': 6090, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 514, 'last_played': 1427020920}
review:
[h1]Torn between pros and cons[/h1]

Yes, developers of SDP Games, you actualy have acomplished to leave me very confused with this game. Why? Because I just don't know if I should give this game a praise for the sometimes marvelous graphics and Sound. Or if I should put you to the stockade of shame for bad voice acting, cutscenes that seem to sap even high powered machines and a very bad adventure script full of stereotypes and... literally superfluid sideploting.

This is more a solve a riddle game than a hidden object game. As said, the graphics are quite good and if the story of the game would be alone with the sound and the graphics be an emersive dream that you wish to go on forever...

Sadly, there are too many issues. The voice acting is at times a real pain in the neck, the cutscenes sometimes seem to stutter (even on a High-End Machine with new graphics adapter) and the story itself is lacking depth, logic and real suspense. The protagonist is too much of a Mary Sue character to be comfortable.

Some of the riddles are ... too easy to give them any credence here, it would have been nice to brew up some new riddles which weren't recycled for the 9th Million time since 7th Guest (And at that time some of the riddles in that game were already as old as Methusala... Shaving impossible... maybe that is not a beard, but some kind of fungal growth). Other riddles were well done and even though the basic concept was used elsewhere the solution was given a new image (the floating lotus riddle for example). 

The hidden object scenes were used to give the game more a feeling like an adventure, and in my opinion that too ruined some fun in this game maybe a mixed solution (as in some construction HOG and more normal HOGs to liven the atmosphere) might have been a bit more into this genre.

The important question is: Can I recomend this game? That would be a no, it is at times a too cheesy story too stereotypical and with far too much, well visiting a history lesson about Siam might have helped the game... also about the unique mythology that this land has. The price wouldn't be too high - if all things would fit into a perfect sheme - but sorry, again no. :epiczombie:

Oh, and yes - I will still play this game further, since I am a completionist... bad habits die hard... insanity dies even harder ;-)

author: {'steamid': '76561197968116408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1426840927}
review:
As a HOG fan I was was impressed with them trying to gnere more modern, but I found the game rather shallow, as they tended to re-spawn objects, and because of the lack of indication what to pick up I found it slighly annoying.  The 3D puzzles were a nice touch, but a bit glitchy. The last puzzle didnt make sense to me.

But as I only buy these games when there cheap with money selling cards, I cant really complain, but it was one of the more disappointing titles in the genre. I would like to say I on the fence on recommending the title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063193728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1426301863}
review:
Loved it!
Your a Archeology professor that receives an invitation from a former student to join him solve a mystery in Asia.
It's a mixed between adventure, puzzles and riddles with a little bit of hidden objects.

Very good story line, nice set-up, the characters are refreshing and fun, especially the Monk ;)
The setting is in modern buildings and ruins, with simulated 3D, so some time not easy to navigate around the place, but the developers included a icon on the top left of your screen to indicate your option in destinations, but not where to look.

I needed to use the help button a couple of time, just to point me in the right direction, but was still fun.
I recommend this game if your looking for more then a hidden object game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165533399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1426454279}
review:
Very good game. It has an original approach to the scenes - you have to look around, they are 3D-ish. The story is not obvious, characters are interesting and animations are realy nice. Voice acting is also very agreable, even if a bit too slow for one of the characters (but I guess that was meant to suit his old age). Music and sounds are wonderful, combined with the animations and moveable scenes it's like you're in the game. Oh, and of course those Indiana Jones references :D
Both hidden object scenes and puzzles are difficult enough to keep the player concentrated, but not to the point of making him bang his head on the keyboard. 
I've already won the game once and I'm just about to play it again, and that speaks for itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144037701', 'num_games_owned': 1487, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1424968613}
review:
일단 이 게임을 다른 사람들에게 추천하고 싶지 않습니다.
아티펙스 문디 사의 HOG류 게임을 생각한다면 큰 오산입니다. 우선 제가 봤던 발번역 중에 최고였습니다. 
그리고 스토리는 정말 머릿속에 들어오지도 않는 게임이었고요. 숨겨진 오브젝트 찾는 게 이렇게 지루한 게임은 처음입니다. 그냥 힌트만 계속 쓰게 되는 게임.
아티펙스 문디의 HOG는 재밌게 잘 했는데 이 게임은 재미가 없었습니다.
그런데 퍼즐들은 나름 재밌게 했습니다. 아티펙스 문디 사 게임들과 셜록홈즈의 유언에 나오는 퍼즐류가 많이 나오더군요. 
아무튼 아티펙스 문디 사 게임을 생각하고 이 게임을 하신다면 크게 실망하실 겁니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032518991', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1449668703}
review:
I'm conflicted as to whether I could recommend this game or not.

-On one hand it had beautiful, intricate illustrations, a solid duration and a lot of puzzles which I found refreshing. It's been a while since I played a hidden object game that didn't feel too short. It also had some charming Indiana Jones references that made me smile and I really liked the protagonist. Bonus points for having different difficulty settings, that's always a nice and considerate touch. The best part is that this isn't a clear-cut hidden object game. It has many mini-games but also many adventure elements that kept my interest and made the experience even more enjoyable. Oh, and it has a bunch of extra hidden-object and other mini-games after you finish the game! Yay!


-On the other hand the 3d animation is almost funny in it's crudeness, which becomes even worse when compared to the aforementioned jaw-droppingly beautiful illustrations. The plot may be interesting but the writing is bad. Some scenes are so poorly written that they become disconnected from one another, to the point I thought I'd skipped some in-between ones that explained how we got from point A to point B (no, unfortunately that was not the case and yes, I double-checked). The voice acting was hilariously slow and boring. 
But most importantly the puzzles were not challenging even on the expert difficulty.

I still had a good time it's true, but there's one thing that really annoyed me, and tipped the scale into me not being able to recommend this. There are 2 specific puzzles in the game, one being the final one, that are near impossible to complete on a pc. It was clear the game was meant for touch-screens and those 2 would have been a breeze if I had one. But I don't and neither should I since I bought this on Steam and not for my tablet. This is something that should have been addressed and fixed before it was released on Steam.

I spent the better part of an hour trying to frantically click through the tiles of the final door puzzle. That was obviously not intended by the developers, seeing how easy that task was on tablets. It wasn't fun and neither felt rewarding when I finally made it.

There are other minor problems like some pixel-hunting and adventuring that just don't make sense -you have to look through the weirdest places to find an item that will give you a solution to a riddle no sane person would ever imagine, but they are not even close to being as irritating as the final door puzzle.

So yeah, I can't recommend it although that doesn't mean it's bad. Overall I had a good time, even if I lost some sanity points somewhere at the end. It's rough around the edges and that simply did not rock my boat. 

Try it at your own risk.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030407858', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1430409028}
review:
アイテム探しやパズルゲームを主体に物語を進めていくアドベンチャーゲームです。
日本語対応で翻訳も適切で違和感なく楽しめると思います。

ゲームは画面をクリックしてアイテムを集めたりドラッグしてそれを使ったりするのがメインで、その中でミニパズルゲーム的なものを発見したらそれを解いていく感じで進行します。
ミニパズルはけっこう楽しいと思いましたが、アイテム探しの方はかなり面倒でこんなのわかるかーって思うような部分もそこそこあります。ですが、ヒントを見る機能やミニパズルをスキップする機能があってかなり便利なので、それを使えばおそらく誰でも最後までクリアできると思います。

他のこの種のゲームにない特徴として通常の画面が１枚の絵ではなく3Dで作られている点があります。マウスをドラッグすると視点が変えられるようになっていて周りを見回しながら隠れているものを探す場面もけっこう出てきます。
ストーリーもけっこう面白い感じですが、後半にかなり軽めですが怖い感じのシーンやグロテスクな感じのシーンもあるので小さい子どもと一緒にとかは遊ばない方がいいかもしれません。

外部ツールによる立体視ですが、3DTVPlayと通常設定でのTridefではゲームがハングアップして使用できませんでした。TridefのプロファイルをGeneric Safe ModeにしてPower3DをOFFにしたらたらOKで立体視可能。ただし設定変更直後にフリーズしたり水面の反射がおかしくなったりします。あとミニパズルとムービーシーンは2Dでした。そのへんはちょっと残念でしたが登場人物との会話シーンなども立体で見れるのが楽しいです。

昔ながらの本格アドベンチャーゲームで遊びたいという人やヒント機能は使いたくないけどアイテム探しは面倒だと感じる方には向きません。
いろんなミニパズルゲームを楽しみたい方や、ヒント機能を使いながらカジュアルに冒険を楽しみたい方に向いています。

author: {'steamid': '76561198031662421', 'num_games_owned': 1340, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1508701778}
review:
Overall, I found this game very enjoyable to play (although it did seem to keep going and going towards the end). I played it on the middle difficulty setting. I've completed the regular game, but I haven't yet completed the Collection's Edition expansion.

As others have said, this is better classified as a puzzle game than a hidden object game. Sure there are some hidden object scenes, but most of the time you are trying to collect objects to complete certain tasks that then result in solving a puzzle or riddle.

Compared to other games in the genre, the artistry in this game is much higher quality that others (you can actually play the game at 1920x1080 and not some upscaled lower resolution). The objects do not appeared muddied or distorted like other games. The view is not constrained to static scenes. It is actually a 3D view with a locked viewing window (different scenes allow different amounts of movement and viewing). There are probably about 25 different scene locations plus about 15 "hidden object"-esque scenes. There were also some additional puzzles.

The voice acting is average. Nothing to write home about, but I've definitely encountered games with worse. Sometimes it can get a little frustrating to sit through conversations where the speaking pace just seems very ... drawn ... out... The story line was descent, although at times it wasn't really captivating (at times I felt like skipping a cut scene, but I didn't want to risk missing a key plot point or hint).

Thank goodness for the hint button. There were times where I didn't have a clue where I was supposed to go next. It usually ended up back tracking to a previous location where a new item had appeared or something was now clickable. I was able to complete all of the puzzles and hidden object scenes without hints, but figuring out the next destination proved tricky at times.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
[*]Many puzzles to solve. Some pretty challenging, others pretty easy
[*]Decent story line
[*]Very nice graphics for this type of game
[*]Not too difficult, not too easy
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]Story feels a little drawn out at times
[*]Full motion video could have been a little better quality. Seems like something out of 2005
[*]Slooooow voice acting at times
[*]Sometimes very tricky figuring out what to do next on your own
[*]Some puzzle solutions seemed way out there
[/list]

Overall, I've give it about a [b]7.5/10[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561197988297046', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1422604776}
review:
숨은그림 찾기 + 퍼즐 + 어드벤쳐(라고 쓰고 똥개훈련이라고 읽음)
다행히 쉬움 난이도에서 힌트를 무한대로 쓸 수 있어서 의미없는 똥개훈련은 조금만 하면 됨.

스토리 망 + 연출 개망 + 한글화 씹망. 
패기 지리는 한글화에 대해 한마디 더 할까 한다. 이 게임의 대사 중 등장하는 once와 one은 "아라비아 숫자 1"로 번역되었다. 번역기에 어떤 알고리즘을 먹여야 이런 결과가 출력되는 거지? 그럼에도 불구하고 이걸 "공식 한글화" 타이틀로 팔아먹고 있다! (나도 당함ㅠㅠ)

그래도 시야 연출하는 그래픽 기법이 신기하여 추천.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969267147', 'num_games_owned': 7582, 'num_reviews': 572, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 737, 'last_played': 1423106065}
review:
A good [b]casual[/b] adventure game, mixing point-and-click puzzles, many cool mini-games, and a few hidden-object scenes. It's an Indiana-Jones-type adventure -- with [b]very[/b] obvious homages -- but with a female protagonist, who is refreshingly not sexualized -- though she's also kept uninteresting in any other way. (And what's with the name Melissa K? Yawn.)

It's an easy play that won't tax your mind too much, but will still offer many diversely satisfying moments. You can sit back and enjoy the plot, engage yourself in medium-hard puzzles, or just marvel at the graphics.

The graphics engine indeed represents a breakthrough for this genre: 3D effects mixed with the usual lush 2D scenes, with excellent character animation direction. It is a treat!

The background story is based on Thai Buddhism, a topic that as far as I know has never been covered in a video game before this one. The research both in terms of story conception and graphics design are surprisingly good, within the limitations of the genre.

review: 별다른 기대없이 플레이 했는데, 의외로 재밌다! 무엇보다 난이도를 조절할 수 있어서 가벼운 마음으로 플레이 하는게 가능하다. 원한다면 언제든 힌트를 얻을 수 있기에 막힐 때는 검색 없이도 힌트를 얻어서 레벨을 넘어가는 게 가능. 매우 훌륭한 퍼즐이라고 하기에는 아쉬운 점들이 있지만, 그럭저럭 포인트앤 클릭 어드벤쳐로서의 게임성은 갖춘 편이다. 단점은, 약한 플롯, 약한 플롯을 더 깎아먹는 아쉬운 성우 연기, 그리고 그걸 더 완벽하게 망쳐주는 한글화(공식인데 구글 번역기 수준)...

author: {'steamid': '76561198098834595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1422722949}
review:
Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold 
                     ทำไมเราถึงซื้อเกมนี้เหรอคะ? อย่างแรกเลยก็คือภาษาไทย!!!! มันเป็นอะไรที่สุดยอดมากๆค่ะการที่ได้เล่นเกมบนสตีมเป็นภาษาไทยซึ่งทีมงานแปลได้ค่อนข้างดีทีเดียวไม่ได้ใช้google translate แปล และในส่วนต่อมาก็คือเนื้อเรื่องของเกมเป็นเนื้อเรื่องในบ้านเราที่เป็นประเทศไทยด้วยค่ะ ซึ่งมีการให้ข้อมูลความรู้ตามสถานที่ต่างๆของจริงส่วนภาพในเกมก็ถือว่าทำออกมาได้สวยงามเลยล่ะค่ะความยาวในเกมประมาณ 7 ชม. กว่าๆ  สำหรับเกมแนวนี้โดยเกมนี้ก็มีในมือถือทั้ง android และ ios เช่นกันค่ะถ้าใครอยากหาเกมที่เล่นสบายๆแนวcasual อยู่เราก็ขอแนะนำเกมนี้เลยค่ะตอนนี้ลดราคาอยู่เงินห้าสิบกว่าบาทนี้ถือว่าคุ้มค่าแน่นอนกับการที่ได้รับอรรถรสของเกมที่มีซับไตเติ้ลภาษาไทยอย่างสมบูรณ์และจะได้เป้นการสนับสนุนให้มีเกมดีๆภาษาไทยต่อไปอีกก่อนที่เกมภาษาไทยจะหายไปอีกเหมือนค่าย.....
                      จุดเด่น
                       - ภาพเสียงทำออกมาได้ดีมีความไพเราะสวยงาม
                       - ในเกมมีวอลเปเปอร์พร้อม soundtrackในเกมเรียบร้อยไปเอาได้ที่เราลงเกมค่ะ
                       - ภาษาไทยอ่านแล้วเข้าใจง่าย
                       ข้อเสีย

author: {'steamid': '76561198073445985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1717, 'last_played': 1421295892}
review:
I put a pretty significant amount of time into this game, but only because I'm a completionist, and once I start playing a game I generally try to finish it.  It's essentially a point & click and hidden object game, with a cliche plot and a pretty terrible script and voice acting.  The puzzles are often well made, and there's a option (and achievements) for playing every puzzle separately and beating all of the "best scores."  Despite putting in the time and doing this, I somehow and missing a bunch of achievements for them.  Perhaps part of the game/achievements are broken.  I know some of them art on Mac at least, because there are 5 more achievements I have credit for in-game that Steam won't register.

As far as the game itself goes, gameplay is a bit infuriating.  At times the narrative of the game and the nature of the puzzles are non-sensical... and you'll most likely need a guide even if you're a very seasoned adventure gamer, not because the game is difficult, just because the game doesn't always make sense within its own design.  Also, in an attempt to obtain the a final item for an achievement, I started replays of both the regular game and the Collector's Edition additional chapter.  Both of these replays are now "frozen" because of broken, insurpassable hidden object scenes that don't have the objects in them I'm supposed to be finding (this isn't a case of me not knowing what the objects are-- I've beaten these puzzles on speed runs for "best" scores and know all of the objects intimately-- they're simply missing from the puzzles).  As both of the games are now broken, I'm giving up on getting the last few achievements.

All of the achievements and broken elements aside, I'd probably rate the game a 5 or 6/10.  Because of them, we're down to about a 4/10.  Parts of the game look beautiful, but it's obviously designed for IPad.  There's one final puzzle at the end of the game that's impossible without a mouse, and seems best played on a touchscreen.  If you're trying to do it on a laptop touchpad (as I was for a time while traveling), it's impossible to complete.  Overall I found the game tedious and not very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975259789', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1419669055}
review:
I'm not a huge fan of hidden object games, but I enjoyed this one very much.  For a game with such a low price, this has quite high production values. The voice acting is quite good, the hand-drawn art is beatifully done, and the 3D rendering was also mixed in very well for a seamless experience. Most of the point and click puzzles were challenging enough without being too overwhelmng. 

That said, the final "reverse Tetris" puzzle was very annoying and felt out of place due to being more of an arcade game instead of a logic puzzle. I guess it's meant to be a bit of a joke because there's an achievement for failing this particular mini-game 10 times, but it still really didn't have a place when compared to the other puzzles.

My only other gripe is that a few of the individual solutions didn't make a lot of sense. There were a few times when the game (via the "hint" button) showed me the solution and I thought to myself, "Seriously? I would never have made that association."

Even with those bumps, the game was primarily a smooth ride. The story was enough to keep my interest and there were several nods to the various "Indiana Jones" movies and made me smile. If SDP games makes more games like this (minus the arcade-y bits) I'll be a repeat customer for their games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084385268', 'num_games_owned': 4156, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1419547565}
review:
I am UNSURE to Rec or Not.Basically if you are fan of HARD adventure games this is for you, if you are fan of casual adventure games this can also be for you(You just need to keep pressing hiints)

I for one dont like how to plot progresses and leaving you with almost no clues in the plot but I have to constantly rely on the hint button.

If you have the patienece to understand and somehow get all the subtle clues. This game has TOP notch quality and awesome 3D idea to change the normal static 2D of most point and click adventure games i played.

I may not finish this game... It is not a bad game but i just could not stomach how the story progresses leaving the player up in the air clicking on everything or just clicking the hint button.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979584400', 'num_games_owned': 3454, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1418408910}
review:
ポイントクリック・アイテム探しアドベンチャー。

タイを舞台にした、女性版インディ・ジョーンズ。（アクションゲームではないので、手に汗握るというわけでもありませんけど）

ストアページにも書かれていますが、グラフィックは２Ｄかと思いきや実は３Ｄ処理されています。
マウスをドラッグすることにより視点を変えることが出来、手前の草や置物等のオブジェクトに隠れた部分が見えるようになります。
Nintendo DSの「立体かくし絵アッタコレダ」みたいな感じです。
面白くもあり面倒臭くもありと言ったところですけど、マンネリ化してきた２Ｄアドベンチャーで新しいことに挑戦したことは評価できると思います。

肝心のアドベンチャー部分ですが、
・動作対象の箇所・アイテム等にカーソルを合わせてもカーソルの形が変化しません。その為、何処に行けるのか、何を拾えるのかが判りにくい。（難易度変更・行き先表示ボタンクリックでヒントは出ます）
・「○○が必要」＝＞「アイテムを探す」が普通の流れですが、このゲームでは先に拾えてしまう物があります。その為よく判らないアイテムが多く、いざ使うときになってもやっぱりよく判らなかったりします。（なんでこんな物をここで？という感じ）
・と思ったら、一度通過した場面でも戻るとアイテムが落ちていたりするので、行ったり来たりが多い。（マップ移動できるので行き来は楽です。画面数は案外少ない）
・ゲームを進めていくと、「狭い隙間からアイテムを取ってくるヤモリ」「暗いところを照らす懐中電灯」等の便利グッズを入手できます。が、先に書いた「マウスドラッグで画面の角度を変える」「カーソルの形が変化しない」為、どのポイントで使うのかが判りづらい。
・ミニゲーム・パズルの種類は豊富。アイテム探しよりも多いです。入手したアイテムが３Ｄ表示され、マウスでグリグリ動かして仕掛けを解いていくパズルもあります。
・隠しアイテム、オマケ・ボーナス機能もあります。一度解いたパズルは再挑戦できます。

最初は面白いと感じたものの、段々と疲れてきました。
製作者も疲れたのか、途中、日本語訳が変なところもあります。
技術やアイデアに溺れてしまったゲームという感じです。
５点満点で３点。アドベンチャーゲームに飽きてきた人にはお勧めです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198046294402', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1417603565}
review:
Die Mechanik verhunzt die mäßige Story.

Cons:
Wie bereits von polednick beschrieben, sind die Wimmelbilder seltener als in anderen Genrevertretern und beschränken sich auf Form-/Teilstücksuche. Drumherum ist ein Adventure gestrickt, dessen Mechanik am ehesten als Parallax-Pseudo-3D zu beschreiben ist. Man dreht und schiebt in alle Ecken, um fehlende Objekte zu finden. Graphisch sind Melissa und ihre goldenen Herzen für ein Spiel aus dem Jahre 2014 zu unterbelichtet.

Leider spawnen Gegenstände an Plätzen, die selten logisch sind. Das Gleiche gilt für Personen. Letztere sind leider arg klischeehaft überzeichnet - selbst für Wimmelbildspiele. Da wirken Abenteurer wie aus den Achtzigern und Geistliche werden verdümmlicht dargestellt. Die männlichen Charaktere gleichen sich optisch dermaßen, dass der Plot ohne namentliche Nennung daneben geht.

Durch das Fehlen von Hinweisen, generiert der Titel (selbst bei überstrapazierter Nutzung der Hilfefunktion) eine Spielzeit von ca. 7 Stunden. Nur hat man in dieser Zeit selten Spaß am Gezeigten.

Pros:
Die Auflösung ist eher unspektakulär, das Bonuskapitel nimmt man mit. Eine Kurzreise-Funktion schmälert den Frustfaktor um einiges. Man kann sich die Schwierigkeit differenziert einstellen, das geht in Ordnung.

Fazit:
Auch, wenn stellenweise Stimmung aufkommt und manche Rätsel kurzweilig sind, fragt man sich oftmals: "Was will das Spiel von mir?". Dazu zählen Hotspots, die man nur durch Herumgeklicke oder Hellseherei findet. Ich empfehle daher, die Demo anzutesten: http://www.bigfishgames.com/download-games/27790/melissa-k-and-the-heart-of-gold/index.html

author: {'steamid': '76561197988858641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1417459025}
review: I don't usually play this kind of games, but I wanted to give it a try, and wasn't disappointed. Almost all the puzzles work out naturally if you think a little bit (i.e. there's the occasional puzzle with an illogic solution, like the banana in the olive oil, but that's the exception and not the rule) and if don't get it or are tired the game doesn't punish you for asking help.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990775928', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1417242259}
review: A pretty entertaining game of its genre. The puzzles and hidden object parts are well below the level of frustrating and actually fun (there is a hint/skip system for those tough times too). The story is a loose take on what could be in a Tomb Raider game, and there's even some homage to Indiana Jones. And a nice bonus is the beautiful soundtrack is reason enough to pick up this bargain!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329288', 'num_games_owned': 2788, 'num_reviews': 1451, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1415650247}
review:
You know what? I walked passed these types of games in my local GAME store but always passed them by becuase I always thought the covers looked too cheesy. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I9t1bMJVHJs
But I have to say I'm very impressed with Melissa K. It held my interest and I don't think I've experienced a graphical adventure quite like it. I seriously was surprised. At times I felt like 'Indiana Jones' and the puzzles were very unique and interesting. The story unfolds in 1947 Thailand, in a world filled with characters, myths and legends from ancient Buddhist tales. The game quotes "Prepare for an unforgettable experience!" and it was! - Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044067612', 'num_games_owned': 12185, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1412476129}
review:
A mix of a point and click adventure and hidden object game, Melissa K and the Heart of Gold brings a refreshing approach to the genre. Alternates between hidden object sections and logical puzzles(where you need to find objects, combine them, use them somewhere specific, etc), and thus becomes more interesting than your average hidden object game.

It's not particularly hard and you stroll along just fine without getting frustrated, making it somewhat of a relaxing playthrough, which is helped even more by the charming artstyle.

Melissa K has a bit more care for the visuals and art than most game I played in the genre. The game is actually rendered in 3D yet it emulates 2D art quite well, making it rather impressive when you actually see that it's 3D and you can see it on a few different perspectives.

For a more casual playthrough, the game offers "Skip Puzzle" and "Hints" options, which can be rather handy when you can't find that darn last piece you need.

Definitely worth it for any Hidden Object game fan, brings a few twists to the genre and it's more diverse than most of the game of the genre because of the point and click/adventure section. Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970259820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1412702316}
review:
Nice game BUT: If you like to play  Hidden Object Games, do not buy this game. Most tasks are "riddles" or puzzles. Hidden object scenes are extremely rare and badly done. In the beginning the puzzles are quite interesting and fun but become more and more illogical and annoying towards the end. I ended up using hint after hint just to get it over with.
Graphics are quite good for that kind of game. A really nice idea was the ability to pan in various scenes and discover items on the edges of the screen. It is an entertaining (at least in the beginning) point and click adventure if anything. I repeat: It is NOT a hidden object game as you are used to it. If you want to try it, I recommend waiting for a sale. Do not buy for 8,99 € as I did ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970078168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 460, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1412085197}
review:
Average point & click adventure game.
This is one of those cheating games, where you review an area in depth but, when you get this or that or come back from here or there there are new things that weren't there. I hate this approach so, I didn't enjoy this game so much.
Puzzles are sometimes illogical. One more negative point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969752619', 'num_games_owned': 5407, 'num_reviews': 303, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1411936063}
review:
A casual point-and-click adventure with puzzles, beautiful art and a decent amount of Hidden Object scenes.
While it has high production values for a HO game, after 2/3 of the game, I kind of zoned out and ignored everything except for the Hidden Object parts, as I was bored out of my skull.
I can't remember when I last heard lines... delivered... so... slowly. Even William Shatner delivers dialogue faster than this.
The writer clearly wanted to make an Indiana Jones or Tomb Raider epic but got lost somewhere in the endless sideplotting and should have focussed less on twists and cut scenes and more on great puzzles.
There is the constant backtracking, where suddenly new items shows up either just after you have visited a scene or 10 minutes later.
The game also has a problem in navigation in that you are really not aware that there might be extra scenes to your left or right, as it gives no indication they are there.
I usually give these types of HO games a thumbs up due to good puzzles, good HO scenes and a decent amount of play time, but the boredom of this made me even skip the extras and the "Collectors Edition" adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058484487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1412204671}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979084213', 'num_games_owned': 4500, 'num_reviews': 1010, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1411688128}
review:
With the tens of releases every month it’s hard to make your game stand out, especially if it’s a hidden object game and when there are already plenty of those available. Neither of those games bring new life to the genre but Melissa K And The Heart Of Gold makes a bold attempt anyway.

There isn’t much to tell because the game is meant for casual gamers and the gameplay is always kind of fun, but ultimately still too shallow. The story brings you to Thailand where you eventually have to solve a case about a missing Buddhist. Further into the game you’ll stumble upon new discoveries which require you to travel to new places and solve even more puzzles. 
The game is shown to you from a first person perspective, which isn’t entirely fixed, but I’ll talk about that in a minute. Your objective is to then find the correct objects to click on and to occasionally solve a (relatively easy) logical puzzle. No, that’s right; it’s not all about hidden objects.
Clicking on certain objects will reveal puzzles or other objects. These objects can sometimes be used in combination with other ones, or you have might have to find a whole set of them. From time to time you have to click on an object and rotate it to unlock a certain item. So there’s actually a very decent amount of diversity to be found here.
Later on you’ll also acquire objects like a gecko and spyglass that you can have access to all the time. The gecko for example will help you grab items from tiny holes and the spyglass can be used to zoom in on far away objects, usually to find hidden/secret messages and codes.
If you don’t want to solve a puzzle or don’t know what to do next you can click on a Skip button (which becomes available after a few minutes) or you can press the Hint button. The Hint button doesn’t give any penalties and can be reused after about 30 seconds, free of charge. See it as some sort of ‘Win’ button. In my opinion, there should be consequences for using things like this, but on the other hand I can understand that the developers want anyone to be able to play and finish this.
A lot of the puzzles later on in the game are farfetched, however, and seem to be made to give the game a longer life. You can definitely tell that the developers stretched out the story. This ultimately hurts the game. Again, this is a game that would’ve been better if it was shorter. These games don’t have to be very long, as long as they’re enjoyable all the way through. I enjoyed it very much until 4 hours in, after that I couldn’t wait to just finish and quit it.
I do have to admit that this is still one of the better hidden objects/casual adventure games out there so even though it might seem that I’m bashing the game that’s not my intention. It’s just that with games like these it’s easier to talk about the negative parts since everyone usually already knows what to expect as far as the gameplay is concerned.

A cool feature that the developers introduced with this game is that the game looks 2D but in reality it is actually 3D. That perspective I was talking about in the last paragraph can also be moved to the left and right. It’s nothing fancy; don’t expect complete freedom here, but it looks great and it’s something that gives the game a little more depth. I wish more games would use this because it makes the game a lot more interesting visually. The art is beautiful and colorful and there’s plenty of detail to be found in them, but sometimes things are tucked away a bit too good. 
The actors also did a good job with the voice acting. Some of it is still terrible, sure, but most of it is at least decent.

Melissa K And The Heart Of Gold is again one of those games that doesn’t reinvent the genre but hey, at least it tried. The developer has integrated some smart (gameplay) elements that should be available in more games like these. It’s nothing big or revolutionary but still good in any case.
For now this remains one of the better hidden object/casual adventure games. If you’re into those I can gladly recommend this. And if not, I suggest you wait for a sale before giving it a try.

[quote]If you enjoyed this review please consider following me: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41144728-markdj/]curator page[/url] [/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198047455981', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 132, 'last_played': 1411953562}
review:
This is my foray into hidden object games as a player.   I've casually observed others play them in the past, so I had some idea of what to expect.   I'm not easily impresssed, but Melissa K. and the Heart of Gold impressed me.   The production values are high.  The cinematics and voice work are better than I expected.     The artwork is top-notch.   The story that creates a narrative for the gameplay is intriguing enough to want to see how it plays out.   The puzzles so far are not brain-taxing, but they are not as brain-dead as something in recent Telltale games (which I enjoy and appreciate as interactive fiction).

For the price, this game is a steal.   We all know that Steam is now overflowing with substandard, buggy, amateur, and ill-conceived titles.  This is NOT one of those.    I find this ttitle a welcome diversion from my console JPRGs and Skyrim on the PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056550672', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1542, 'last_played': 1411390597}
review: 3D可移动视角的场景设计让这款传统的Click & Find解谜游戏显得与众不同，谜题难度适中而且提示很人性化，过场CG在此类游戏中也属上乘，推荐购买。
